Reviews.Title: “Great Location with outdated decor”
Reviews.Author: ToniT2011
Reviews.Content: Loved the location on the top end of the Ramblas. Easy for picking up airport shuttle. Rooms are really outdated though a nice size and clean. I would give it an average if it wasn't for the location, but you are in Barcelona so who is going to be in the ugly pink room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it...”
Reviews.Author: Nardz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a triple room. Nice size, clean and comfortable. As stated in other reviews, the location is prime. Hit up the snack bar a few times, as it will save you a few euros. Balcony facing the street was nice with a cup of coffee in the morning and a cocktail at night.

Reviews.Title: “Just like the ugly duckling ......”
Reviews.Author: rakersfield
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Continental on Las Ramblas is just like Hans Christian Anderson's 'Ugly Duckling': it's a little 'tattered and torn' but underneath, there's a swan! £100 per night for a room with a balcony overlooking the most famous street in Barcelona, twenty yards from Playa Catalunya and its Metro Station, two minutes from the Airport Bus terminus with 24hr unlimited food (not cordon bleu but perfectly adequate), ice-cream, coffee, tea, orange juice, beer and both red and white wine and even plastic bags should you wish to make yourself a picnic - who could ask for more. So Okay, there are occasional bits of worn carpet, the lift is small (but works!) and access to the various floors is gained in a manner, at first confusing but subsequently simple, some of the furniture is of the plastic garden chair type (but all covered in beautifully tailored covers) and the rooms are very pink. They are clean and tidy (the housekeeping is superb with clean towels each morning), the beds are comfortable (though perhaps a little hard for some tastes), the double glazing very effective at keeping noise levels down and the balcony with its table and two chairs a bonus. The staff are are friendly and helpful, especially Peter on the front desk who is the font of all Barcelona knowledge. Did we enjoy our stay? Yes we did. Would we return? Too right we would. Would we recommend it to our friends? We already have. Quirky it may be but we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: dmtjrg
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews about the hotel before booking and I must say they have summed it up very well. I do not think it has a 24hr buffet more of a snack bar (good for breakfast though) and the beer and wine on tap was great. A bit noisey but you cannot blame the hotel for the people that use the building. It really is in a wonderful position and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BlueJax
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, great location close to Place de Catalunya - so easy to get to (airport bus costs 5.30 euros - and its a 3 minute walk from the stop), staff are really friendly. We had a balcony room overlooking La Rambla - so great to watch the people going by below. If you can get over the twee-ness (the pink bedrooms and green reception areas) then its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz but a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tulacat
Reviews.Content: The main reason to stay at this hotel is the location - it couldn't be better. It is a short block or so from Placa Catalunya, where the airport bus stops, and it is on La Rambla, the main tourist street in the old town. We were in Barcelona for just three days, and we were able walk to everthing we wanted to see. The rooms are oddly decorated, it is true - lots of pink, lots of plastic. Bathrooms are small - it is Europe after all. Beds were great. Staff were helpful. We appreciated the 24 hour buffet, though we really only used it for breakfast, which we thought was just fine. We had a room on La Rambla and had some noise at night - I would be more concerned about noise in the summer. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony right on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: kathleen e
Reviews.Content: I was there with a friend in early November, 2011. Our room had a balcony right on La Rambla. We could sit on it and watch the lively activity below us. The room is very pink, which was OK with us. The staff was friendly and helpful. We booked partly because of the 24 hour buffet. When we saw the food, however, we were disappointed. We passed on the food, but availed ourselves of the beer on tap. Another reason to book is the excellent room rates. The location is unbeatable. A block from Placa Catalunya, around the corner from the airport bus, and within walking distance of most of what we wanted to see. For everything else, the metro is steps away. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, decent place”
Reviews.Author: zhenya
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel by any means, but it doesn't cost that either. Clean small rooms with all the amenities you'd expect at a two star hotel. The location is unbeatable. It is right on the main boulevard La Rambla, only few minutes walk to metro, and only a few minutes walk to an express bus to/from airport. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast is nothing to write home about, but will get you going in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: emm-you-eff-see-ok
Reviews.Content: Quirky hotel,with friendly staff.The buffet was very welcome,particularly the wine and beer! The rooms are not the plushest but it does not detract from the overall value.We had a balcony room and sat out and enjoyed the celebrations on las Ramblas as Barca fans went mad after their el classico victory over Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Best!”
Reviews.Author: sdadabhoy
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is on the Ramblas where all the action is...amazing hotel, we had a balcony which overlooked the Ramblas. loved it! The hotel was very clean, comfortable and their endless buffet is available at all times. I didnt much at the Hotel as there are so many restaurants to discover in Barcelona but anytime we wanted snacks , we would grab from the buffet. Staff is very helpful. gave us great tips..I would def go back and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: afcj1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Continental for 2 nights, pre-cruise. I had read enough reviews, not to expect the same standards as an American chain, though the room was very clean and comfortable. We had a balcony on La Ramblas and with the door closed in the evening, we couldn't hear anything. Great soundproofing. Yes it's designed with pink and a lot of plastic, but it made no difference to us. We asked that the room not be cleaned, because we'd have too much to put away, but were still offered clean towels. There were a bunch of us cruisers staying there, so the patio was a comfortable and convenient place to meet each other and catch up on our day. The "free" beer, wine & soda was nice to have available. The 24 hr buffet...well, don't expect to get a full meal. It's good for snacking or grazing. The elevator is old and very slow, so we used the stairs a lot. Also, the hotel is secure with buzzers to let you in, since they share a building. Lastly and most importantly, my fiend whom I was with left a necklace in the safe and never even realized it. After we came home, I had an email letting us know that they had found it, WOW!! That was impressive. I asked them to send a picture of it, which they did (since we had no idea if it was even ours), then we communicated with them about sending it back. If I'm staying in Barcelona again, I'd definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Janet L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Barcelona and stayed at the Hotel Continental for 3 nights. Overall the location is fantastic. It's right on the Las Ramblas, close to the Metro, and close to major sites. There was free WiFi which is always a plus. The hotel itself was pretty bad. First the hotel hasn't been updated probably since the 1950s. The elevator was really small and shook a lot riding up which was uncomfortable. When we opted to take the the stairs down to the street level it felt like someone was waiting around the corner for you. Once we finished checking in and they directed us to the 24 hour buffet. Some of the food looks like it was sitting out there for days with nats flying around it. We just stuck to dry cereal for breakfast. Housekeeping only came once while we were there even after we requested it. The rooms are very small with rock hard beds and plastic drawers for you to put your clothes in. The bathroom is a totally different story. The sliding door to bathroom never worked and my husband got stuck in there a couple of times. The bathtub is really high and I slipped and bruised my knee one morning. The room in general were very uncomfortable to be in. The hotel walls are paper thin. Our first night was a Saturday night and we can hear people up and down the hallways, talking outside in the courtyard, etc. Basically we did not sleep well one night when were there. Maybe next time we should bring ear plugs. Having said that the hotel is great on a budget. Its pretty cheap so we basically got what we paid for. The staff in general was nice just wish the owners would put some money into updating the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: helmerphud
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is one of my favorite cities in the world. We stayed at the Hotel Continental during our first visit to Barcelona in 2002 and were highly impressed with the value, staff, and location, so we've stayed there during our visits ever since. We've referred friends and family who've stayed there over the years as well; some repeatedly, and all very satisfied - in fact, I've never heard anything negative about this hotel. We stayed there again for several nights in November 2011 and were pleasantly surprised by a number of upgrades since our last visit, including an expanded 24-hr buffet and an outdoor garden patio. LOVE the patio! The hotel has free (and fast) wi-fi, and computers available for guest use if you didn't bring your laptop. The location can't be beat - on La Rambla right at Catalunya Plaza, in the heart of town. There is a EuroRail/Barcelona Metro station within 100 feet of the Hotel entrance, as well as a major taxi stand a few doors away with taxis available 24/7. The hotel is right on the edge of the Gothic District (a great place to get lost in!), a major shopping district, a residential district including buildings designed by Gaudi, and - of course - right on La Rambla, which is one of the major centers of Barcelona life. Within a 5-block radius from the hotel are a number of 4- and 5-star restaurants, small shops, major department stores, the Gothic Cathedral, Roman ruins, small family-run restaurants and tapas bars...and every time we go there, we discover something new and memorable. The staff is very attentive and obliging, the rooms are clean, the location is perfect, and the price is extremely reasonable - what more could you want? We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The good guys deserve to be recognized”
Reviews.Author: pilgrimnoprogress
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location. Easy access to airport bus and metro. Half a block away from on-and-off sightseeing bus. Close to great restaurants -- especially the nice Catalan restaurants that are off the main tourist streets. Very friendly staff. Good breakfast and cheap beers and wine. Free access to Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Little Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Lynn S
Reviews.Content: Although it can get a little loud at night it really is a GREAT location. The rooms were very clean and the service was wonderful. The 24 Hour buffet was nice and the unlimited, beer, wine and soft drinks was a nice touch. I would definitely not hesitate to stay here again. La Rambla is right below so beware it can get a little crazy but for me that was the best part of being there.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New Fairfield, Ct. and Fort Lauderdale, Fl.
Reviews.Title: “Very unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobk64
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night in the hotel, but really appreciated all it offered, especially the location -right on the beginning of Las Ramblas. We found the Continental Barcelona on Rick Steve's hotel recommendations. We had a room with a balcony that looked out onto Las Ramblas. Staying here we would highly recommend taking a balcony room. It was great to sit outside and watch all the action on Las Ramblas. We had the pink room. Everything was done in pink -bedspread, drapes, etc. The room was a bit quaint, comfortable but not upscale as your will find in some hotels. The tub/shower was high. So it was a bit difflcult getting out of it after showering. The Continentla Bareclona features a continental breakfast, snacks, drinks all day long. the quality of the food was average, but free. Can't complain about this. If you are arriving by bus from the airport, you will get off at the main plaza. A few blocks walk you will be on Las Ramblas. A half block down, on your left, you will find the hotel. We had a slight problem finding the hotel. The front desk is located on the first floor (not the ground floor). You take the elevator up to the entrance and they will buzz you in. Once you are inside you can get to your room. The hallways are broken up a bit, like a maze. For the price and location, this hotel is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “For some reasons, we love this place!”
Reviews.Author: rawalpindi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel ourselves as a result of reading Rick Steeves' book. The location was the primary factor; we arrived from the airport to the Placa Catalunya and had a short hike to the hotel at the "top end" of the Ramblas. We could have been off-put by the fact that the elevator was out of service and did not resume service during our stay. However, the staff were so helpful and friendly that this inconvenience was soon forgotten. We loved the quirky decor in our room and found all to be clean and tidy if a bit small. Those pampered souls who enjoy luxury should not stay here. We loved the free buffet, the warm wine and the warmer beer and enjoyed our breakfasts on the patio. We simply walked out the door onto the Ramblas and began our adventure in Barcelona. The staff were very friendly and the manager on duty when we were there had excellent English. We saw one of the premium rooms with balcony overlooking the Ramblas but our room with its quieter ambience was more suited to the needs of two seniors on the road. Another plus was the low taxi fare to the cruise ship terminal. The bottom line is......would we stay there again?......you bet we would!

Reviews.Title: “good for students on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: lindaruthe
Reviews.Content: We immediately looked into switching hotels. We found that within two blocks of this same location, by paying just 20 or 40 Euros more, one has several options for getting a normal hotel. The good: the location the helpful reception staff the free high-speed internet the air conditioning works The bad: eating breakfast on paper plates with plastic forks, and styrofoam cups plastic bureaus and end tables! (we've never seen this before) dark dinghy hallways no nice lobby no CNN or and only one international TV channel

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely visit !!”
Reviews.Author: dennyandtony
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this lovely quirky hotel a couple of times and have recommended it to various family and friends. I can understand that it wont be to everyones taste-especially if you like minimilist, Ikea type rooms. We love it!! we had a balcony room which can be noisey but with windows shut I slept very well. The buffet is usefu,l especially if you are on a tight budget-the food is not haute cuisine!! but filling and free!! The staff are exceptionally helpful and I felt very secure as there is CCTV everywhere. The location cannot be bettered. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ON Las Ramblas, quirky but fun - and a 24 hour buffet”
Reviews.Author: gearheart
Reviews.Content: Right ON Las Ramblas, half a block for the metro, you just can't beat this location. You can walk just about anywhere, and if it's further out the metro is easy to use. We heard someone say that this hotel was like falling down the rabbit hole. It IS a little odd in that the stairs and hallways tend to meander all over the place, but it's really a nice place. The price isn't bad for the location, but when you through in the 24 hour buffet (they call it a fruit and juice buffet, but they actually had real food too), you can save a lot of money on meals (and breakfast in Spain isn't a common thing). Our rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a problem with the safe and they came right up and fixed it. There's an indoor dining area as well as an outdoor one. A little balcony by the lobby. We would gladly stay there again. Note; the lobby is on the first floor (which is not the ground floor).

Reviews.Title: “Location is key! Affordable too”
Reviews.Author: MickCT
Reviews.Content: We recently chose to stay in the hotel for 4 nights (Oct 2011) during a first time trip to BCN because of it's location right on the Ramblas. It was a good call particularly for that reason. If you're coming to Barcelona to spend your days chilling out in your hotel room then find another one. This hotel is for getting a good nights rest in and a hot shower in the morning before you start your day. OK, so the decor is completely pink (mine and my girlfriend's worst color) and it's not the cleanest hotel in the world but if you can get past that, it's quite adequate. The front office staff were very helpful and friendly and I could not fault them at all. If you're choosing this hotel for the inclusive 24/h buffet then you'll be disappointed. It's not good. It's a snack bar and should not be a deciding factor in your decision unless you really love ice cold beer (and wine) on tap which was nice after a long day. I also really enjoyed my freshly made espresso in the morning too. (all inclusive) Would I go back? There are so many hotels to choose from in BCN so I would probably try another one just for a different experience. But not because there is anything majorly wrong with this one. You do get what you pay for so don't expect a 5 star experience, although the service was up there with it's better competitors.

Reviews.Title: “Ecclectic & lovely!”
Reviews.Author: JoannainLA
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most bizarre places I've ever stayed, but I absolutely loved it. It had ALOT of character. And the staff couldn't have been friendlier. Make sure you get a quiet room away from the balconies of Las Rablas though. Very convenient location & it was very easy to get to the AeroBus for our trek back to the airport the next morning. 24 Hour snack & drink buffet on-going was a great service. Breakfast & wi-fi included. I would most definitely stay here again and again. Really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: susanlyla
Reviews.Content: I stayed as a single person Sept 29-Oct 4, 2011. The location COULD NOT HAVE BEEN BETTER. Every single staff person was exceptionally helpful. The room was big, even thought it was standard, and impeccably clean. The bathroom was big and impeccably clean and new. Someone remarked on the plastic drawers in the bath and bedroom. They were perfect for storage and impeccably clean. I LOVED the 24 hour buffet: free wine, beer, ice cream, chicken legs, chocolates with nuts, pastas, quiches, veggies, fruits, etc. I never had to eat out. Great espresso machine, two kinds of milk, juices, sodas, water with lemons, ice, etc. Truly, I couldn't have been more impressed. And the balconies overlook the bustling Ramlas. Perfect. My room was quiet, in the back, and had a little outdoor patio with a table and chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, if you're about fancy hotels, this is not for you.”
Reviews.Author: antormarchi
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night after our cruise. I knew before going what to expect. I was not aware that the building is shared with two other hotels, so the elevator which is already tiny can take a long time. Going up the stairs with bags was not fun. Staff was nice and friendly. The 24 hour buffet was not bad, includes beer, wine, water, coffee, juice, tea, and ice cream. The windows surprisingly kept the noise out really well, which was a concern of mine being on La Ramblas and having a balcony room. Expect Pink panther, it is all kinds of pink. Small room, but just what you need. Had a fridge, microwave, tv, and Wi-fi. The bed was not soft, but I did not notice any back pain, which I normally have. La Boqueria food market is close by where you can buy food and bring back to room, also a grocery store across the street. Over all I think for the price it was very well located on the Ramblas, less than a minute walk to Metro station Catalunya, lots of stores and shops around. It's not a wow place, but it delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lgeber
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the recommendation in Rick Steves guide. We weren't dissapointed with our choice - hotel is clean, staff at the reception is super-friendly, food and beverages, including beer and vine, available around the clock. Hotel is centrally located - at the heart of Ramblas, steps to the subway station, walking distance to the Passage de Gracia and even Sagrada Familia. The only thing that I'd change regarding our reservation, that we didn't request a room with a balcony that is located in the front of the building and looking at the Rambla. If you decide to have the room with a view to enjoy the balcony and people-watching - make sure you bring ear plugs. Rambla at night is not a pleasant place - homeless people are practically screeming at each other, street trade is going on through the night - and also very laud. Other then this - the hotel is a very good value and I would still recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritgrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night before and 1 night after our cruise last year in Sept 2010. Since we did not plan on spending much time in the hotel, we wanted a economical/budget hotel in a good location. Backed by a Rick Steves recommendation, we chose Hotel Continental. Staff was great, rooms are small, unlimited beverages were a plus but its all about location here. From the airport there is a bus that runs directly to the plaza about a block from the hotel so that was very convenient, at about 5 Euro/pp. It is also a quick taxi ride to the port (if you don't have luggage with you it’s an easy 10-15 min walk to the port). Located directly on Las Ramblas, we enjoyed walking around seeing the street performers, vendors, and restaurants close by. We also booked a bus tour of Park Guell and La Sagrada Familia directly from the hotel, which we were able to do the morning before our cruise left the port. Also recommended: Visit Les Quinze Nits, a restaurant in Placa Real. Beautiful plaza and atmosphere, good food, economically priced, and real spanish sangria!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ud_lilmike
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for your first stay in Barcelona. The Hotel is in a great location, just a few steps from Plaza de Catalunya, and right on La Rambla. They have food/beverages available 24/7 and this even includes beer on tap. The staff is super friendly and helpful. If you are really into the decor this might not be your place, but i could care less. All of our beds were pink, which we thought was hilarious....but at least they were comfy and the rooms had AC that you can control. The door buzzing system was a bit strange at first, but after you get used to it it is fine. They monitor the halls so even after you are at the front desk you must buzz to get through the door on your floor. The good part about that is that bums from la Rambla cannot get onto your floor.

Reviews.Title: “Lively location, in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Travelerkk412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on La Rambla with a great view of the energy of the city if you get a street view room. The location is close to metro stations and many restaurants and the culture of La Rambla. Street view rooms can be a bit loud at night with the balcony doors open but when shut it is very quiet. The full buffet 24/7 adds a convenient touch to your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 22Karen
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the 'Continental.' I booked two twin rooms with a balcony. My friends & I were very impressed with the convenient location right on the Ramblas. We were able to sit on the balcony late in the evening, people watching. It was very interesting to see the goings on on the Ramlas while we wound down with a drink. The rooms were clean & adequate for a city break. Everyhing we needed was in the rooms. Fridge , microwave, safe, hairdryer. The staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful. there was a 24 hour buffet. nothing fancy but had a large choice of snack food. Also at certain times of the day freshly cooked spanish omlette or rice & pasta dishes were put out. water & soft drinks were always available. Also there was a coffee machine. I would definately stay there again if I was in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: samexp
Reviews.Content: Awesome location right on top of Las Ramblas. Nice staff. Free beer. What's not to like in this hotel ?

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it highly enough”
Reviews.Author: JoannaCymraes
Reviews.Content: The location was superb for a city base, right on the Ramblas and opposite the metro. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were there in August and the rear terrace was a godsend during the heat of the day. The hotel offers a free 24-hour snack/drinks bar, including wine & beer, and this saved us a fortune. The hotel is old and quirky with bags of character, not for people who favour shiny and new. Also free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting experience and helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chrssher
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights pre cruise; location is great! Easy to find when coming from the Aerobus, and close to everything you want to see in BCN. The Ramblas is as written by previous reviewers; very lively and entertaining. This is great for people-watching during the day, and into the evening but the balcony rooms are very noisy well into the night. Ask for a room in the rear if noise bothers you. The food bar was an interesting extra; loved the free soda, beer and ice cream and breakfast was adequate. The snacks were of good qualityand obviously prepared freshly; I watched the ladies preparing the sauces fresh each morning. The hotel itself winds around within two or three floors; what an interesting setup! The rooms are a bit eclectic but spotlessly clean. I was surprised to find that the 2 beds we paid extra $$ for were actually just hunks of foam, but that was ok for our two kids. I would have been very disappointed if we were four adults. The staff was very friendly and accommodating; we really enjoyed the outdoor patio in the morning and evening. Would recommend this hotel for the location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie02m
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Barcelona and this hotel really enhanced it! We stayed 4 nights and had the room right next to the dining room with a balcony that overlooked La Ramblas. We loved the free (albeit foamy) beer, wine and cappuccinos. Every evening we would sit on our balcony with drinks and play cards or simply watch all of the people on La Rambla. We had a fantastic dinner at Dos Trece nearby. We took the Metro everywhere as one comes every 4 minutes and the Catalunya stop was right outside our door. We also had a very cheap but wonderfully delicious sandwich at Bo 'de B on our way to the beach one day. Those 2 meals were my favorites in Barcelona! We stayed up every night until 2am and slept in until noon and it was reasonably quiet (occasional noise from Ramblas and a baby crying occasionally in the dining room but at a decent hour!) We loved our stay in Barcelona and would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MANDM1970
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! It has been a couple of years since our last stay but I still wanted to express how special the Hotel Continental is to us. My husband and I have taken two cruises out of Barcelona in the last few years and both trips began and ended with a stay at this hotel. The hotel staff has always been friendly and very helpful and while this hotel may not have the buffet or décor of a Four Season’s property, we feel it does epitomize the character and mood of a vibrant, exciting & artistic city. We always get a balcony room and love sitting out and taking in the sites and sounds of Las Ramblas. Then before setting out to explore we stop for a bite from the buffet or some coffee, soda, beer or my favorite, ice cream, all included in the price and available anytime! The location of this hotel is perfect for visitors, you have transportation, restaurants, shopping and even a department store with a huge grocery store downstairs all nearby and with comfortable shoes you can even walk to the beaches of the Mediterranean. As far as the noise and possible crime of the tourist area…crime can be found anywhere, you just have to be smart and aware. The noise is just a part of Barcelona’s wonderful vibe. If you only feel comfortable in a main stream, predictable hotel like a Hilton or Westin then this is not the hotel for you. But if you want a fun and interesting introduction to Barcelona, try it! I wish I was there right now! A note to the Managing Director and Owners…I am impressed that you take the time to read and respond to so many of these reviews. Please don’t change what you do or how you do it or get so busy that you don’t have room for us next time we come to Barcelona…it would not be the same without a stay at Hotel Continental!

Reviews.Title: “One gross experience”
Reviews.Author: thesspayne
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a long weekend in Barcelona. We found it through Rick Steves. The hotel itself was okay - we're used to medium/budget accommodations. It was clean enough, although the decor was really weird. While the buffet was handy and a good deal, the food was not that good but we found a couple things we did like. Here was the deal breaker. The second day we were there we were walking down the stairs. We saw - and I'm sorry to be disgusting - a giant pile of poop on the stairs. It was so gross. A few steps down was a puddle of pee. I thought, oh no! I better quick tell the staff! So I went back up and told them and they said they hadn't known and that they'd be right on it. That night we came back and it was still there. Next morning, still there, so I told new staff. We left the next day and it had NOT been cleaned up. The staff said that they were waiting for a janitor (I believe we left on a Monday morning, so this happened over a weekend), but I don't get why they couldn't have cleaned it up themselves. It was so unsanitary and really low-brow. For us, this was a deal breaker!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: yr66
Reviews.Content: I came across this hotel in Rick Steve's book and decided to book it for its location and character, part expecting it to become one of those funny travel stories where things don't work. However, it met all my needs, conveniently located, clean, didn't smell like an old place, nice front desk staff, free WIFI, breakfast/buffet was limited but again good enough for me and the kids loved getting pop and ice cream anytime! We are a family of 4 (kids 10 & 13) staying a couple of nights pre-cruise, had a balcony room on third floor overlooking the Rambla which was magical to sit out on with a beer (included!) watching the sunset and the people streaming pass. When we closed the balcony door and the air con was on we didn't hear the street noise at all. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & amenities”
Reviews.Author: luv2cruise2
Reviews.Content: I spent one night precruise at the Hotel Continental Barcelona on May 17 & enjoyed it a lot. After taking the airport bus to Placa Catalunya so close by, I walked to the hotel, located on the Ramblas. Unfortunately there were people standing at the entrance who told me the elevator wasn't working but didn't tell me there was a bell to ring for service so I dragged my suitcase up the many steps. Check in was quick & I was shown to my single room 378 which was of course pink! The room was quite nice but had a not so great view. I had a little rest after the overnight flight, then freshened up & went back up to Placa Catalunya where I bought the 2 day pass (30E) for the HOHO bus & took the blue route. It was lovely & I took lots of pictures from the top deck. It went by the 2 Gaudi buildings that I wanted to visit. Came back to the area & walked down the Ramblas to La Boqueria market which had things I had never seen before. Had some tapas up the street for dinner then went back to the hotel where I talked to some other cruise people on the neat terrace near the food stations & had a little dessert. There was also beer ,wine, food & other drinks for free. There was another place to gather at the front of the reception floor overlooking the Ramblas & a computer for use by the guests who didn't have their own laptops with them. The next day, after a lovely breakfast & before checking out I used the HOHO bus as transport to Casa Batlo then walked to Casa Mila (discount coupons for both places were in the HOHO booklet) & took the regular bus back. Had a cold drink while I awaited the cab they called for my trip to the port (20E incl tip). An employee carried my bag downstairs for me. I really liked the hotel & would stay there again if I returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - we left early”
Reviews.Author: dalesman98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Continental based on a recommendation from friends. However, we were disappointed and left after two nights instead of the four nights we had planned. The hotel location is great - right on Las Ramblas with lots to see and do nearby. There's a good supermarket a few blocks down the street and every kind of shopping, although it is VERY touristy. There's a subway station two minutes away, although you may have problem finding the hotel when you come back, because the subway station is huge. There is free Wifi and a couple of computers in the lobby, all of which worked fine. The front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. However, the hotel itself is very run down and not much above the level of a hostel. There actually IS a hostel in the same building. The rooms are cramped and the furniture consists of plastic storage units and cheap plastic chairs covered with material. Some may find it quaint, but, to us, it just seemed cheap. The bathroom was small, but functional, but there's no storage. The balcony (for which you pay extra) is tiny and you are so high up, you can't really see what is going on down below. The quality of the buffet is poor and and the "patio" (with more cheap furniture) is disappointing - surrounded by ugly buildings. The hotel corridors were generally in poor shape. The elevator broke down while we were there, although it was repaired the same day. We understand that it isn't terribly expensive, although $175 per night isn't exactly cheap, but there have to better hotels than this !

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but outdated.”
Reviews.Author: KMNchicago
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location if you want to be near the Ramblas which ended up being a very dangerous area. It's nice to be near Placa Catalunya where there is a lot to do. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms were nice, but VERY outdated and tacky. I don't know if I would stay here again. I would probably choose somewhere a little outside of the high tourist areas due to noise and crime. The buffet was weird and the wine was out of a coke machine...very weird. I stayed away. The breakfast was odd too even for Europe. The staff was very helpful and friendly though!

Reviews.Title: “Decent 3* on Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: West_Coast_YVR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Las Ramblas so if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room at the back. We had a balcony (premium) room in the front and kept getting woken up from the festive yelling and screaming coming in from teh street below. Las Ramblas is the happening place and if you've never been to Barcelona before, you must experience this location at least once! We had arranged for the hotel to send a car to meet us @ BCN and despite our delay of about an hour due to lost luggage, the driver was still waiting for us (thankfully!). As others have written, there is a 24 hr buffet of sorts. Also, free beer, wine juice, coffee, etc. Not the best quality but really, you get what you pay for. Our room was small but clean. Bed was hard and of course, everything was pink. On our departure day, the lift broke down but we didn't mind taking the 4 flights of stairs with our 2 pieces of luggage each!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Barcelona!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovessunandbeach
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Barcelona was so wonderful in part from this amazing hotel. The 24 hour food/fruit buffet will keep your trip cost down and it was great to have a beer whenever. The room was small, but had a great balcony facing the courtyard and a strong showerhead. Also the bed was extremely comfortable. The best thing we can say though, is their customer service could not be beat. It was great!!!! They even tracked my lost luggage before I asked. Such a beautiful view from their great room overlooking the action packed La Rambla also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatNYC1
Reviews.Content: A friend from Spain recommended Hotel Continental to me, so I expected it to be good. We stayed here for one night before going to the Benicassim festival and we loved it. It's incredibly central to everything, right off Plaza Catalunya and minutes from where the Airport Aerobus lets you off. The customer service was fabulous (thanks Silja and Roger!) Knowledgeble people at reception made it easy for us to find the hop on bus/train/restaurant and were extremely helpful in all regards. Great view of La Rambla from our balcony. The free computer and wifi made it easy to facetime and keep in contact with folks back in the USA. The room was clean, pretty, (all pink), and the totally free fruit, drinks, dishes, desserts provides a lovely touch. Air conditioning, shower, hair dryer- all worked perfectly. This was out first time in Barcelona and we only had one full day to explore but this hotel and the recomendations from the wonderful staff made it a great experience. If I ever return to Barcelona, I'll stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Cin D. B.
Reviews.Content: Like some others we stayed at Hotel Continental Barcelona, pre cruise, the weekend when Barcelona won the champion soccer match against Manchester. For us, it just added some extra fun and excitement to our vacation. We had specificially reserved a balcony room because you can't get a better location on Las Ramblas for people watching, observing vendors selling, and the seeing the amazing street performers there. It's also just around the corner from the Plaza Catalunya. There's even a rather large "grocery" store within walking distance down the street. I would recommend spending the extra euros for the balcony. It's just part of the "experience." Now if you can get past the all pink interior and the fact that your room key is part of the energy-saving on/off switch for all the lights, this hotel really is a great place to stay for people who like people. If you want to keep to yourself in a cold, modern hotel-- so be it. THIS IS NOT AN AVERAGE U.S. CHAIN HOTEL! This is a wonderfully quirky, great value for your dollar, ideal location for the city, no hassle place to be. The staff were all friendly and courteous. Even the night of the Barcelona win, the owner, Jose, gave us a free bottle of Cava (the Catalonian version of sparkling wine) to enjoy. There was always some substantial food on the buffet day and night, and my husband said he would stay there again just for the free cerveza (beer) and the fantastic espresso and cappucino machine, but our room was big enough and comfortable and clean! There's a nice outdoor sitting area too, that's like having their own "cafe" if you are so inclined to eat outdoors instead of the general dining area. I was able to get on to the free wi-fi on my laptop in my room with the password with no problem, but most times I could just stop in the lobby and use their free computers to check my email or Facebook. We really enjoyed our first trip to Barcelona, and part of that was due the fact that we had such a positive experience at this hotel! My only regret is that we could not stay longer. My recommendation is THINK PINK and enjoy yourself at the Hotel Continental Barcelona. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: omalleys100
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at Hotel Continental with my husband and 2 friends and would thoroughly recommend it. It is situated within touching distance of Metro station (Catalunya) so getting about was easy. The staff are very friendly and informative. Gave us excellent tips on restaurants etc. Facilities at the hotel are good. Rooms clean and comfortable and worth paying extra for a balcony room overlooking Las Ramblas. 24 buffet was an added bonus. It wa so nice to pop back for a quick snack and drink during the day and very welcoming at the end of the day or returning in the evening. Beer and wine were particularly good. Excellent hotel - keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: beachsoulfl
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visit Barcelona prior to boarding a cruise from there. This hotel was right on La Ramblas and less than one block away from the drop off from the aerobus that brought us from the airport for 6 Euro .50 each! The hotel offers a 24 hour "buffet" that included beer and wine on tap. It had free internet and the staff were very helpful. For us it was a perfect match!

Reviews.Title: “Mort than adequate”
Reviews.Author: jads2
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony on Las Ramblas. Location is great, and so is the view! I haven't had a lot of experience with European accommodations, it was a little sparse but adequate. They have an all day buffet that I didn't enjoy, but i don't regret staying at the Continental.

Reviews.Title: “We still love this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: chriskat60
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at this hotel and again it didn't disappoint. We stayed there for three days after our cruise . As usual the staff was very helpful. They gave us directions for a day trip to Montserrat and Sitges. We were able to use the subway and the trains to get to these places with ease. It was nice to come back to an appealing patio with refreshments that were absolutely free. Then go upstairs to a nice, clean , air conditioned room overlooking the Rambla. When we returned home the hotel asked us if we had left anything behind. My husband realized that he didn't have his watch or ring. I guess the maid found the items left in the room. They fedexed them to us. That kind of honesty is really admirable. I can't say enough about this hotel except to say , I hope to go back again , soon.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh, with so many other choices do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: avissantacruz
Reviews.Content: What a horrible place! I booked months in advance and so I was dissapointed when I was given a run down, dirty, outdated, small, no amenities (like soap)l room. The ceiling fan was hanging by a thread and the bathroom too small for even a cosmetics bag and DIRTY! After complaining, I was moved for the next 3 nights to an "updated" room. They told me that the hotel was being renovated but they hadn't done my room yet, however the price they were charging me was the same for the renovated room!! (they did discount it when I complained). The hotel elevator broke the 1st day I was there and remained broke for the rest of my stay. The hotel is on the 3rd floor. Management refused to discount the price for anyone, (or so they told me) although lack of an elevator was a huge hardship for many of the seniors . Lastly, dont go for the 24 hour free buffet unless you like raviolis 24 hours a day. There was nothing that even tempted me free or not.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: gmfarfol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barcelona during Easter Break this year. We arrived from Madrid in the middle of the week using the AVE. Taking the Metro to the Ramblas was easy. The hotel is just half a block down the Ramblas from the Metro. In fact--we walked out of the Metro, crossed the street and were in front of the door. The hotel is on the second floor, so we took the elevator. I was surprised at the big carved door that swung open as we stepped out of the elevator. We had arrived! The desk clerk spoke English and was very helpful. A nice gentleman took us up to our room and showed us how to control the lights and A/C. The room was PINK!!! Everything was PINK! But that was okay. It was a quiet room, despite being on the Ramblas which was crowed and noisy. Our 17 year old son has a cot on the floor and we had 2 twin beds shoved together to make a larger bed. There were closets along one wall--with roses on the doors--so did the bathroom door. The bathroom was large with a great shower in the huge bathtub, a bidet, and lots of drawers for our stuff. There was a microwave and small refrigerator in one of the closets. We removed 2 chairs from our room to make more space, but it was definitely adequate for the 3 of us. The hotel is very convenient to the Metro and the Ramblas. We walked everywhere or took the Metro. The staff was the best! They helped us find places to eat, how to get places and made calls to confirm train schedules and more. The buffet is open 24 hours a day with fresh food put out continuously. The drink bar was also great--wine, beer, soda, water and more. There is a dining area to eat in and a lounge area to just relax in near the main desk. Also a small balcony to hang on and watch the action on the Ramblas. There is a computer for guests to use to check email. Our first night there was the big game between Madrid and Barcelona. The hotel put out a huge TV on the outdoor terrace and broadcast the game. Great fun! I highly recommend this hotel. We had a great time in Barcelona and most of it was due to the wonderful stay at the Hotel Continental Barcelona! We got a discount with our Rick Steves tour book.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: amd23561
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in - it is high off the ground so be careful getting out!! We had a balcony room and it was so lovely just to sit and watch life go by on La Ramblas! The free food and drink was great - saved us a fortune, although it is basic (but so tasty, typical Catalan food). Dont be put off by the "eat and throw" paper plates etc - it is an excellent idea unless you prefer proper cutlery and plates of course. You can even take food out with you if you wish. We stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago and the improvements are huge. The only thing I didnt like so much was the fact that drinks were all on tap so you couldnt really make use of the fridge in your room but this is only a minor niggle. Absolutely love this hotel. Staff always happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nikdoh
Reviews.Content: Very helpful friendly staff Excellent all day buffet,incuding hot & coldrinks very handy on arrival Rooms very comfortable & secure, a personal safe provided It has got to be one of the best locations for a sight seeing trip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, just what is needed!”
Reviews.Author: Kelboy69
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner stayed here for 3 nights and was just what we needed. The hotel is liferally of Las Ramblas and you can walk to all the bars, cafes and restaurants with ease! The hotel itself has basic rooms, a little small but decent bathroom and power shower, comfortable bed, also air con & free safe. Bonus is the hotel offers free intenet access and free food and drink 24 hours including beer, wine, soft drinks, ice cream etc. The food is continental - pasta, breads, tortilla, fruit, paella, cold meats and eggs! The beach is a good 20min walk, but its a nice walk with lots of outdoor cafes to grab a cold beer or sangria on the way! There are loads of little back streets off La Rambla so you may want to spend a few hours exploring to get your barings when you arrive and locate a few nice places to eat or drink. Would go back to this hotel and would not bother consdering another!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: xAnn2002x
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed in the Hotel Continental for four nights. We have previously stayed at its sister hotel the Hotel Palaceta. Although the Palaceta is much more grand the location of the Continental is far better - right on La Ramblas. From the minute we arrived which was quite late at night, until we left ,the staff were so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. The 24 hour buffet is great and came in handy the following day as we were tired from our travels and didnt get down to breakfast until late, which you cannot do in lots of other hotels as breakfast is usually set times. Wine and beer is on tap also 24 hours a day which was good to come back to at the end of the day or after coming in at night and wanting a nightcap. The rooms although not over big are very clean (and pink) which we knew from staying at their sister hotel. This was not a problem at any time as we only used the room for sleeping in. We had a room with a balcony overlooking La Ramblas which was great to people watch and to see the street entertainers but if you are a light sleeper i would recommend you ask for a room at the back as it is quite noisy until very late with people going past. The room is fully equipped with a free safe, microwave and a fridge to keep your drinks cool which is also an added bonus. The location is very good as the bus from the airport is just at the end of the street and the metro station is almost outside the hotel. This is our second trip to Barcelona and we will definitely be back. It is a great city with lots to see and do and the food is just delicious. We will not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Continental when we do return. Thanks to everyone who made our stay so wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a supreme Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anticuari0
Reviews.Content: Thank's for the great time with supreme service and 24/7 standing buffet with good food! But though, those pink rooms gave me the worst nightmares. So thanks again, I'm going to pink rehab!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jorgecwd
Reviews.Content: We were in best location in Barcelona, near everywhere. The hotel was very comfortable and the people who work there were even better. I highly recommend it. Best value for money. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Really well located. Extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: degol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days. We are a family of 4, my husband and 2 little kids. The staff was really nice with the kids. The 24hours buffet was great for them. Having the microwave in the room was a big help traveling with the little ones. The room was clean and big enough. Location could not be better. Very good relation price quality

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: wally13131313
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in February 2011 and the location is great. Walking distance to Placa de Catalunya where all buses are and buses from airport. Also can walk to Pablo Picasso Museum,La Boqueria (large indoor market with small resturants and bars) and within walking distance to waterfront area to catch a bus to cruise ship. Walk takes about 30-minutes-easy! Hotel has 24-hour cold buffet with good bread-we ate all meals there but most people would not. Have all the beer and wine you can drink with coffee,tea and soda-24-hours a day. Many people complained about foam on beer but is Free! Room small-all rooms Pink!! Clean with 2-3 computers in hall all free. Paid around 90.00e by showing Rick Stevs book on Spain. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good price”
Reviews.Author: BCtourists
Reviews.Content: I searched long and hard for a place to stay in Barcelona and read a lot of reviews in TripAdvisor. We ended up staying at the Hotel Continental, and what a great choice. While it is not the fanciest place in the world (the rooms are very small), and I wouldn't want to have an extended stay there, for a few days it is a perfect spot. It is located right on Las Ramblas, which is probably the busiest, most entertaining street in all of Barcelona, only a few steps away from the metro station (so very easy to access from the airport or anywhere in Barcelona). Our room was quiet but did not overlook Las Ramblas as we had heard that it could be quite noisy. There are loads of restaurants in the area and lots of sights to see. Although they have a 24-hour buffet, I would not recommend this as your sole source of food, but for snacks it is great. The hotel has free wifi and also several computer terminals. The staff are very helpful and will provide you with lots of recommendations for things to do and see while in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Merg55
Reviews.Content: We elected to stay at the Continental for 1 night after our cruise. This isn't a fancy hotel nor are the rooms big however we found it to have charm. It was very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. The entrance is shared with other business. There is a small elevator that you take to the correct floor. When you get off a door to the hotel opens and you walk to the lobby. We were early and they stored our luggage and then we were able to go and do what we wanted to do. We felt very safe staying there. The location is GREAT! From the hotel you can see the Metro entrance. We enjoyed walking around the area. That evening we are very tired and having a teenager with us decided to just walk around the corner and have dinner at the Hard Rock Café (Which was very good and very close) The Room was simple. I had never seen furniture like they had in the room. It is plastic Patio chairs and stools that are covered. Different but workable. The bed is firm but comfortable. We had a room with a balcony, which I highly recommend. When we doors were closed it was quiet. Really enjoyed sitting and watching everything going on in the street. We also enjoyed having the buffet of more or less snack foods. In the evening we sat on a outside and enjoyed their drinks or soda, beer and wine. We used the computer in the lobby area to check in for our flights. We asked for a taxi to the airport when they arranged and the taxi arrived on time. We are very glad we stayed and recommend for someone who isn't looking for a large and fancy place but one that is fun and unusual.

Reviews.Title: “The service is impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: Catsanastasia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both this hotel & its sister hotel, The Hotel Palacette for a total of 14 nights between the two of them. The Continental has the best location, & I'm pleased that we paid the extra amount for the balcony room overlooking the Ramblas. Even though it was November, it was fun to sit out on the balcony to people watch and enjoy the sunshine. The sizes of the rooms vary, and I found our room to be perfectly adequate. It also was not noisy even though it was on Las Ramblas. The wi-fi works even though it was a bit slow in the room (but hey, it's free, so no complaints here!). The food was good & varied and really is available all the time. Look at the website - the pictures and descriptions are right on. What really made this hotel & The Hotel Palacette stand out was the staff who are extremely helpful and speak excellent English. See my review on The Palecette for more on the excellent staff who went above and beyond to accommodate us. Of the two hotels I preferred The Continental because of the location & the balcony. The Palacette is not that far away and has much plusher surroundings although the rooms are similar to The Continental as well as the food available, etc. TIP: The A1 Bus from the airport is extremely convenient (we used it several times), inexpensive, easy to use, & drops you off right in the Placa de Catalunya which is about 5 mins. walk to The Continental. When you get off the bus, Les Rambles/Las Ramblas/The Ramblas (Catalan, Spanish, & English respectively) is almost diagonally from you if you turn to your right. So go to your right off of the bus & walk to the end of the block (one of the corners of the Placa), & cross the street. Then, make a right at that corner go about another block (to the next corner of the Placa). Now look to your left & you are facing The Ramblas. The Continental is just about another one to two minute walk on your left side.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Johnlcruise
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights 21,Oct. and found this hotel to be GREAT. The Location was the best you can walk to just about everything or take a bus. La Rumbla is the place to be and I found it to be very safe. Just be a smart traveler..Room was very comfortable and clean and the staff was GREAT. Very helpful and friendly. Buffet was OK for breakfast or a quick snack. But for a real good meal go to a tapas bar. I had a great time in Barcelona and in my 4 days I still did not see everything. Can't wait to return. and yes If I'm traveling solo again I will stay here. Can't beat the price and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Everything one could want”
Reviews.Author: mariner11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four days in October. From the very first the staff could not have been more helpful. Our room was not ready and we were offered breakfast and our luggage stored. Peter, the staff member we dealt with,could not have been more kind. He showed us where things were and accompanied us to our room. Our room overlooked the Ramblas and was extremely clean and quiet. The pink decor was something we expected and it added to the fun. The 24 hour buffet was adequate and constantly being restocked. Our room was clean and the bathroom large. Every member of the staff spoke english and was very helpful. The hotel has free wifi and two computers for the use of guests. There is a refrigerator and microwave in each room. The location of the hotel is right at the top of the Ramblas and easy walking distance to transportation and tourist information services. This is a unique hotel,well worth the experience of a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy but Funky and Fun”
Reviews.Author: gigiparis
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again as it was very clean and the service was outstanding. I loved sitting on my balcony and watching the street performers on the Ramblas, drinking the (free) wine while waiting for the very late dinner hour for which the Catalonians are so famous. I would recommend as a great value as long as one Must like Pink!! Very unique decor!

Reviews.Title: “Strange & Quirky but great location”
Reviews.Author: cruizingrammy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights post cruise having read all the reviews. Yes, it is very pink in the rooms, the balcony on La Rambla is great and the food was so-so. However, the room and bathroom were clean, the bed was very comfortable with good pillows and the staff were friendly and helpful. The 24 hr. beer & wine was wonderful, the location was unbeatable. The elevator and unusual entrance to the hotel were a bit of a pain, the carpets in the common areas could use replacing, but I knew that beforehand so the hotel was as I expected. It was perfectly fine for 2 nights and being right on La Rambla was a wonderful experience. Everything was close by including the Market and good restaurants. This hotel would not be for every taste but if you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel and you want a very central location, this is it. Lots of shopping nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Location and amenities are the value here”
Reviews.Author: dmbkDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Hotel Continental. The staff is very friendly and conversant in English. The location is great. The rooms are a little dated, but the inclusive buffet, wine and beer offset this. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay there unless you are on the budget”
Reviews.Author: z1z
Reviews.Content: The stay at this place almost ruined all impressions from our vacations in Spain and I do not understand these positive reviews here. Yes the location is great but have I seen the pictures of this hotel I would never booked it. So, people just click the link with pictures and they will tell you everything.....

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Tipperarymartin
Reviews.Content: we stayed in hotel continental for 2 nites, it is situated right bang in middle of barcelona, easy to find only 30min by aero bus to catalyna and then 5min walk to la ramba well signposted, we stayed in a room with a balcony that over looked la rambla and it was fantastic not at all too noisy, yes the rooms are a mad pink colour but they are clean and medium size, when you first arrive at the door it looks like your going into a private house but you get the lift up to the first floor, staff great and friendly and speak great english, they also have a FREE yes FREE BEER AND WINE 24 hours a day you just serve yourself! And also free buffet food, I would fully recomend this hotel in a heartbeat to anybody and we will be back to stay here, A room with a balcony is well worth the few extra euro ..you will not be dissapointed with this hotel ... superb.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel Room”
Reviews.Author: viajerob
Reviews.Content: I made aterrible mistake booking this hotel. yes the locatuon is great(is the rambla) but in general the room (wich is pink) is very small for two people..the door to the bathroom crashes against the bed when we try to open it ( no space) no wardrove but rails to hang the clothes ...i mean it is a mess. the food is a bufet but such a bad quality (the orange juice is not orange juice, it is powder juice) and we basically eat out coz it is not good. The internet doesnt work properly on the rooms if u have a lap tot.. I didnt like staying in this place and its expensive for the product they offer!!!! By the way...it shoyuld be a hostel because they are in the same building with 2 other different "hotels" that i guess are the same quality as this but 3 hotels sharing a building ...come on ....

Reviews.Title: “Very, very Satisfied with Hotel Stay including price and location”
Reviews.Author: landruu
Reviews.Content: Found the Continental browsing website for a low priced hotel in the Las Ramblas area of Barcelona. We stayed there one day before and had reservation for the day we returned from our Western Mediterranean cruise July 18-26th. The hotel was better than I expected with a very, very friendly staff (all spoke English), fantastic location, clean rooms, great a/c, and great bathrooms. I had my wife, 2 grown children and son-in-law with us. I quickly found that any of the negative comments made about the hotel had to be from people who just look for the negative. The front desk girls were helpful in explaining the Metro, suggested restaurants, let us store our luggage, just couldn't be nicer. Just off the Plaza Cataluna, you can walk easily to and from the Aerobus that goes to and from the airport at a bargain price, 5 euros. I loved just sitting on a bench in front of the hotel on Las Ramblas and watching the street performers and hoards of people walking by. We had the same great experience on our return from the cruise and enjoyed our one day extra stay there, too. I would definitely go back there because why pay $200 or more at a hotel when the Continental gave us all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “No Place Better in Barca”
Reviews.Author: john_petrush
Reviews.Content: Wife & I and 4 relatives stayed here for a week in late June. The rooms were very nice; the food and drink buffet was quite good; the location on Las Ramblas can't be beat; and the price was VERY reasonable for what you got. This was my second stay here. If the Lord sends me back to Barca, I will surely repeat.

Reviews.Title: “A true budget hotel with a great location & service”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel, but that's what it is, a budget hotel. So, make sure you're a budget traveler. The pluses are the price, location, service & free breakfast. We had a problem w/ the safe not working properly for a few days (out of the 11 we stayed). Luckily, we had everything we needed out of it & could leave the rest w/ reception, who by the way are super. All the reception workers were extrememly helpful & knowledgable. I also had a problem w/ the 1st room we got (252). My problem, when I looked out the window into a very shabby inner space, it had broken windows on the other side & someone could have possibly gotten into our room as it was close to the ground. Not saying it was likely to happen, I just didn't feel safe, so I asked to be moved to a higher floor & was the next day very pleasantly (room 383). Good room w/ a small terrace w/ no special view, which was fine as I did not pay for a room overlooking Las Ramblas. I liked the room. Lots o' pink, but that's fine w/ me. The location was excellent, right near Placa de Catalunya & its metro. Ramblas is way touristy, bustling & noisy, though, w/ a high theft alert. I had no problem, but 1 woman in our hotel did, but she held onto her bag. Just be alert & hold your bag. This has nothing to do w/ the hotel, however. It's truly a tourist hotel w/ a lot of Americans, British,German & Dutch. All types of nice people & quite a few families.There's a free breakfast either outside on a rooftop or inside & there's food all day long w/ free cheap wine & beer. I really only partook of the breakfast & the ice cream & toppings late at night. Read Rick Steves' book. His info. is pretty dead on, and there's a 5% discount from reading & mentioning his book. Also, they have 2 computers to use & free wi-fii. It's not a perfect hotel, but all in all, I found it quite satisfactory for the price, location & service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, and yes, it's pink”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights prior to a tour. Because arrangements were made on short notice (ash cloud changed travel plans), had to stay in two different rooms. First night had a balcony room overlooking La Rambla - surprisingly quiet despite the large crowds roaming around. Second night in a quieter interior room. Yes the decor is something to behold - Rubbermaid drawers fashioned into furniture, weird assemblage of switches for lights/blinds/etc, and yes, just about everything is pink. But clean and comfortable. Desk staff were friendly and helpful. 24 hour food buffet wasn't always jam packed, but always fresh fruit, rolls, drinks, and more choices at breakfast time. Microwaves in every room so easy to get something take out and supplement with the buffet. Also free WiFi and computer in the lobby. Excellent location - just steps from the metro, about 2.5 blocks from the Airbus stop, and a few minutes walk to just about everywhere you'd want to go in the central city. And yes, there are pickpockets on La Rambla, keep your wits about you in the crowds and late at night. I felt very safe staying here though, no worries at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location with some quirks..but we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AndiS77
Reviews.Content: We checked into Hotel Continental after staying in Munich on a two part journey to Europe. We were looking for a pace to stay a few nights before heading out on a cruise and we were very pleased. At check in the gentleman who was the manager was extremely helpful and polite. This put us at ease as the ride up the elevator and entry way to the hotel lobby was a bit different than what we'd seen elsewhere in Europe (probably just us). He showed us to our room which was just to he right of the main lobby area by itself. Pink, pink and more pink..lol. The room was quirky but was such a far cry from our basic rooms in Germany we just took it all in and laughed a bit. I wanted a hot shower and went into the bathroom and discovered the mystery of the "open bathroom". There wasn't a tub or a shower exactly...there was a shower head with hose and a shower floor with a small rim around the bottom but strangely now shower curtain? So I tried to stad in the corner of the shower so water wasn't everywhere. That didn't really work. Luckily the entire bathroom was a beautiful marble (yes sort of pinkish too) and dried quickly. The amenities (other than the strange bathroom) were fine. We loved to drink wine and beer on our balcony and watch the action in front of our hotel before we ventured out. Perfect view of one of the most interesting areas of the ramblas with the best performers. A far as noise I am a light sleeper but was fine after we lowered the electric wall cover for the doorway to the balcony. Let me tell you after you shut the glass doors, lower the wall cover (a switch on the wall) and draw the curtains the room is black and quiet! The location was absolutely perfect for everything we wanted to see and do. Five minutes up the hill to Plaza Catalunya where we caught the hop on hop off buses that went almost everywhere including the beach, Park Guell, and all things Gaudi. The Gothic quarter was almost bordering our hotel and the old ancient roman gravestones that were uncovered were only about a ten minute walk behind the hotel as well. Lots of great shops off the main ramblas area where we ad the best pastry ever that we are still talking about today. The 24 hour snack bar was very adequate with creamy pasta salad w/ham, curried potato salad, spaghetti and meat sauce, italian bean salad, ravioli, and varying other offerings. They had a large bread and cereal station with all kings of toppings and nuts too...we put fresh hazelnuts on vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce a few times. They also had beer on tap, the local beer Estrella Dam..cold and appreciated :) Every morning they cooked egg souffles and breakfast meats. They also had a drink station with many options from red/white wine, espresso/cappuccino and juices/sodas. We saved a ton of money and were very satisfied, we only ate out a couple of times. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: pcwalton1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel before and after a recent Med cruise. Yes the location is great if you are looking to stay near the major Barcelona tourist traps. Yes it has 24 hour buffet (drinks were good, only eat the rolls since everything else looked scary). On the surface the price seemed reasonable, but when our stay in Barcelona was extended due to the volcano, we found that there were other bargins to be found. For one thing there is no shuttle so even though some other hotels may have been more, they had shuttles which saves about 40-50 euros (roundtrip) to the airport. Also if you get a lower level balcony room the noise from La Rambas is difficult (I slept through it by my wife did not). Having found other reasonably priced hotels during our "extended" stay, I am not sure if this would be my first choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Awfully pink, or just plain awful?”
Reviews.Author: archaeogal
Reviews.Content: We spent one night post-cruise at the Hotel Continental based on other cruisers recommendations. The price was right (117 E for a balcony room overlooking Las Ramblas), but not so sure about staying there again. First, every single surface in the rooms is covered in PINK! The drawers consisted of stackable plastic bins, and the room was extremely cluttered by 2 chairs, a small round table, 2 square platforms (for suitcases?), a wardrobe for hanging clothes, etc. Each room features a microwave, small fridge and safe, along with hair dryer, all nice amenities. TV was a flat screen mounted up near the ceiling. Balcony had 2 nice chairs and a table - all good for overlooking the action along Las Ramblas while writing postcards. The main attractions for us were the location, price, and promise of free 24-hour food buffet items along with beer/wine. The food offerings were pretty unappetizing, and looked like they had been left out for a while. They did offer soft-serve ice cream with a variety of syrup toppings, and excellent coffee & cappicino from a machine. Noise from Las Ramblas made sleeping almost impossible. People were partying at all hours of the night. Others in our group had non-balcony rooms (less expensive at 87 E/night) but reported no views from their windows at all. Someone was almost pickpocketed in the hotel's street level foyer. On the plus side, the hotel is 1/2 block from the Aerobus stop at Placa Catalunya, and a short walk from La Boqueria Market (where someone else in our party was pickpocketed). The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby balcony was another good people-watching spot to hang out in, and there was a small patio off the buffet area. But, the decor was tacky and dated, and the room wasn't someplace that I'd choose to hang out in. I'm thinking there are better lodging choices in Barcelona than the Hotel Continental.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service in Time of Crisis”
Reviews.Author: shuttleboy
Reviews.Content: Got into Barcelona and parked inside the Saba Pl. Catalunya parking garage nearby and left 2 bags in our rental car while checking into the hotel. Returned to the car 20 minutes later and the bags had been stolen. The driver's door lock had been broken into. NEVER PARK YOUR CAR IN THE SABA PL CATALUNYA - they were worthless and even made us pay to leave after getting robbed in their facility. We were traveling to France for an ice skating competition and the stolen bags contained my wife's and daughters' figure skates, costumes and show props and all of my clothes. The owner/manager of the Hotel Continental took great care of us. Obviously, our time in Barcelona was ruined, but we survived because of the help we received from the hotel. They helped work with the police, made sure we were safe and comfortable and were absolutely phenomenal. I will stay at the hotel one day in the future and see Barcelona. Rooms were nice and very comfortable. Very nice mattresses. Showers were excellent. We had 2 rooms, but all 4 of us stayed in one room because we were shaken up. Thank you Jose for everything during this tough time for us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Euopean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbge10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is funky and fun. Excellent location in walking distance of many restaurants and shopes. Having the 24 hour snack bar was great for a late night glass of wine of a coffee. We had a room with a balconey on the street and were not bothered by noise. If street noise is a problem. ask for a room off the street. Internet in t he lobby. Staff was always available and very helpful with all requests. Great location and value. If you are looking for a unique hotel with European flavor, this is the place for you. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, go to the Ritz Carlton. I have recommended this to two friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: desmetlax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Continental Barcelona in June 09 for our honeymoon. We were doing a cruise that started in Barcelona so we got to the city a day early to check it out. We had a fantastic time and I would highly recommend traveling to Barcelona. This hotel was perfect for us. Location and price were our two main criteria with a big emphasis on location. The hotel is located right at the top of Las Ramblas, which is the main pedestrian street with all the action. Pay up the extra $10-$20 for a room with a view of Las Ramblas, it's well worth it as long as you don't mind the noise from the hustle and bustle. I read a few other reviews that said the noise was a problem, but it didn't bother us and we're pretty light sleepers. The hotel is located right by a metro stop making it extremely convienent when traveling from the airport. We never took a taxi and used the very modern metro system the whole time. The top of Las Ramblas where the hotel is located as opposed to the other end by the sea is also a lot safer a night. The rooms themselves were not anything special. Do not stay here if you are looking for a 5 star hotel with a spa. The mattresses were firm, but more comfortable than the hotel we stayed at in Paris. The bathroom was actually pretty spacious compared to other hotel bathrooms in Europe. You will get a kick out of the light switches (by the way, you have to put your key into a place with the light switches in order for the electricity to work, also you have to have the balcony window closed if you want the A/C to work, very much about energy conservation). This is definitely a small traditional hotel you would expect to find in Europe, however it had the feel of a B&B with the friendly staff and the 24 hour food and drink buffet. The wine was just a house wine but the beer was pretty good. The hotel has free internet access which is a rarity in Europe. The manager at the front desk was British so it helped we could speak to him in English. We also had a situation where we had to check out in the morning but our cruise didn't leave until that evening. We were able to store our luggage in a storage room at the hotel so that we could explore the city a little more. As long as you're not looking for luxuory, I highly recommend this hotel. It served as a perfect homebase to see Barcelona. A couple tips about the city: If you like trying new foods, you should fnd a restaurant/bar that serves pinxtos. They usually consist of a small piece of bread with some sort of meat or fish on top of it along with a cheese, sauce, or something else with a toothpick holding them together. The fun part is that there are plates filled with different types of pinxtos all along the bar and you just grab a plate and help yourself. You pay based on how many toothpicks you have left over.
