They were relativily cheap at a euro and change so we were able to try a lot of different foods at one time without breaking the pocket book. I would say rioja is the wine of choice there, and the glasse I had were very good and affordable (2-3 euros for a glass). Lastly, in case you are heading on a cruise: A taxi can take you right to your cruise ship, however taxi's are definitely your most expensive option. You can take the metro from the hotel down to the mouth of the port at the bottom of Las Ramblas (or you could walk it, probably 3/4 of a mile), and then take the "blue" bus to the actual cruise ships. There is no sign for the blue bus or labeling of the bus itself, but it is the color blue so that's how you know which one you want. There will also be a relatively long line of people with luggage waiting for it. The bustop is just NE of the big Columbus statue. Have a great time on your trip, enjoy the city, there's plenty to see in way of art, cathedrals, and culture. The food was very good there, however there's probably less English spoken in Barcelona than other European cities. Brush up on your Spanish, but be aware that they actually speak Catalunyan there (I would say it's a Spanish-French hybrid).

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: starcitydee
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced. Interesting decor. Desk clerks speak English. 24 hr snack buffet and breakfast buffet. Convenient location at the top of Las Ramblas very near trains and buses. Short walk to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tocanada2
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. I stayed here two nights after a cruise. The location is perfect - right on the Ramblas and an easy walk from where the airport bus drops you off in the Plaza. The free beer/wine/coffee machine and food is a great bonus especially when you arrive after a long journey. There are two free internet computers (one by reception and the other on the second floor). Peter, the receptionist is fantastic. This hotel is owned by the same people as the Continental Palacete and there are a lot of similarities between these hotels. Of the two, I actually prefer this one. It is a bit cheaper, is right on the Ramblas, has draft beer (rather than cans) and has an ice cream machine! The hotel shares an entrance with two other hotels and there is a common elevator that often seems to break down. There are 57 steps to climb if it does -and it did! For E77 per night, it is excellent value and of the the 5 different hotels I have stayed at in Barcelona, this is the one that I will certainly try to come to next time. My room was at the back of the hotel where it was very quiet. You can pay extra to get a room overlooking the Ramblas and that would be fun but could be a bit noisier. andrew

Reviews.Title: “Winter Hollidays”
Reviews.Author: CarlosMSequeira
Reviews.Content: A pleasant hotel, well located in one of the most important Barcelona "Rambla's", and near Plaza Cataluña.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sclmkl
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel in mid October, the hotel room seemed clean but first morning got out of bed an saw several blood streaks across sheets. Thought maybe I had a scratch that bled and went out for the day. That night looked at the sheets and they had been changed looked them over carefully and no blood. Next morning woke up with a couple of bites on my arm and streaks of blood in about 6-8 places on the sheets, a couple of little black bugs on the sheets . It was very crowded in the lobby area so we felt funny saying anything and left. We got on our cruise and I was sceeved out so we had all the clothes that were out in the hotel room washed on the ship (73$). We thought that was the end...boy were we wrong A couple of mornings later woke up at 3am itching like crazy, the two bites were now bumps all up and down my arms and VERY itchy. In the morning there were more. It looked like I had chicken pox (had them as a child). We were in Venice and went and got creams and Benadryl but didn't help much, it was spreading rapidly . Bought different antihistamine creams and cortisone cream in Dubrovnik, now spent about $50 on meds. We saw no evidence of any bugs or blood on the cruise ship and hubby was't effected. Well the last 6 days of my cruise were not fun with the itching and rash but pills and liberal application of the cortisone gave me bits of relief When I returned home I went to the doctor who said yes, it was a bed bug bite and the subsequent rash was from it. UGH!! Seems the saliva of the bed bug causes an allergic reaction and causes the rash which spreads from scratching. I emailed the hotel and they were rude and dismissive, I am a travel agent and will never put anyone in here again (used them quite frequently before this), not because of the bugs, (5 stars have had them) but because of their nasty attitude when I notified them. My biggest regret is I didn't take pictures of the bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very strange hotel with prime location”
Reviews.Author: AP_Russia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Reallly excellent! On Rambla, next to Plaza de Catalunya, near a subway station and a airport bus station. We booked the hotel just because of the location and the room rate. Rooms are so-so. Firstly we got the smallest room on the floor with 2 small windows to the tiny courtyard where the disposal dump is located. The courtyard is under a roof so when you are in your room you cannot understand what the weather outside is. Considering the fact we were on our honeymoon (and the staff was informed about it), it was "a bit" disappointing. After our request we were moved to a bigger room with a balcony to another courtyard. Comparing to the previous one, it was very satisfying. :) As to the hotel interiors, they are very strange. Some dark variegated wallpapers... Mechanical doors like in a thriller movie! To get out from your floor to the lift hall you should call to the reception and they will open a door for you. Uhr... BTW the hotel shares the entrance with 2 other hotels of lower class. So no one looks after this entrance and you can easily find a tramp sleeping downstairs or somewhere near the lift. One positive thing is 24h open buffet! As to the meal, you won't find anything tasty there but at least you can get cornflakes, fruits and soft drinks any time! The breakfast is the same as this buffet plus an omelette. One inexplicable thing. Somehow this hotel gets very positive reviews in their book at the reception. I really don't understand how people get such an excellent impression from staying in the Hotel Continental. In general. The location is excellent. But I'd recommend you to look for something around.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: marSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located on Las Ramblas where people stroll night and day. The time we loved the most was sitting on the balcony, sipping wine from the 24/7 wine and beer bar!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: bassiemom
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel at all. All you are paying for is the great location and there are several hotels in the immediate area that must be better than this one. The room was scary bad, the hotel is in terrible shape and the buffet was sub par (we never did see the sodas and bottled waters as advertised). My photos show not only the view from our room but what you are surrounded by if you eat on their patio instead of in the dreary inside area. Feel free to email me for more details.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mcbabci
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel with a convenient location, this is the place. You can take the airport bus which goes to Plaza Catalunya and it will take you 5 minutes to get to the hotel. It is a block down from the Plaza. If you want to be where the action is, you can sit on the balcony and watch everything going on down on Las Ramblas. If you are going to take the hop on hop off bus, it's 5 minutes away. And if you like to stroll around, it's easy to get to the old part of town and also the new section. This hotel is old and quirky but you get a 24 hour buffet with wine, beer, soda, and juice. You can snack whenever you want . There's free internet. And the staff is very helpful. We stayed in August with our family before taking a cruise and the young kids really enjoyed it. In September we stayed with friends and they agree with us that this hotel is a real bargain. It's always full, so plan ahead. Both times we had very big room, but some people we talked to had tiny rooms. So speak up and request a large room.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: AuroraCeleste
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Hotel Continental Barcelona, and were very pleased. They were able to store our luggage before check in and after check out, since we arrived early and left on an overnight bus. They also have a computer with internet that guests can use for free in the main lobby. The snacks were more like side dishes, and both nights we were able to make dinner out of them, which we ate sitting on the lounge area balcony and watching the street performers on the Ramblas. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of hot water. The pipes were pretty loud, but closing the bathroom door shut out the sound, so I wouldn't let that keep you from staying here. The location and 24-hour snack, drink, [delicious and fresh] fruit, and ice cream bar definitely make this worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Dated decor, but great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: avalongirl185
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th anniv. with a family cruise in Aug. 2007. We ended in Barcelona and spent 2 nights at the Hotel Continental Barcelona. Nothing glamorous here but convenient to everything - a short walk to the Metro and right on Las Ramblas. The staff was friendly and helpful and the 24-hour snack bar was very welcome. To say nothing of the free bottled water. Yes, the rooms were tiny ad strangely decorated, but adequate for the time spent in there. The bathrooms were clean and provided great shower pressure. If you are looking for a truly lovely lobby and rooms, go elsewhere, but all 14 of us in our family LOVED this hotel and definitely would stay here again. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pink hotel at the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Reiserundt
Reviews.Content: You should be prepared for pink, pink and even more pink when staying at this hotel! But thats how the manager have desided to have it, and I think thats what makes this hotel so unusual. Its a 3* hotel, you pay for a 3* - dont expect 5*. Its not spotless at all, but not dirty either. Right now there are some rebuilding going on, but thats ok. We had a flooding in our room because this work going on, but we got another room instantly. The staff are helpful and welcoming. The owner are also around every day. Clean sheets and towels. Good aircon and fan in room. Normal sized bathroom. The buffet is ok as a snack or having a few beers on the balcony overlooking the Ramblas. The location are great for visiting the town and shopping, but far away from the beach. Easy to find when arrive with airport-bus to Placa de Catalunya

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ismartcat
Reviews.Content: Staff at reception counter is very friendly and helpful. Speaks good English and knows all sightseeing spots well, giving very clear instructions on which metro line to take and useful tips. The 24-hour snack bar and free Wi-fi internet service are especially impressive. Room is very cosy with a fantastic verander, looking over the busy La Ramblas with lots to see until late. Central location makes it a pleasant starting point to go anywhere. Would definitely go back:P

Reviews.Title: “Only if desperately in need of the location”
Reviews.Author: go_ramsay
Reviews.Content: Maybe for a night If you get a room with view on ramblas and you can stand noise and are twiggy like so that you fit on the mini-toilet squeezed next to the wall and obstructed in front by a toiletpaperholder, the bathroom is damp, mouldy, tiles broken off with sharp edges, metal supports rosty. The place is a tight dump with fitted heavily stained carpets. The rooms claustrophobic . The 24h buffet unappetizing and without variation. The beer and the espresso are ok. The reasonable airconditioning, themicrowave and good refrigerater in the room and the friendly and helpful reception staff soothing but the deficiency list is grave and too long to report all here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0609
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Immediately, when you walk in the front door, the smell of mold overwhelms you. The "snack and breakfast" bar reallly consists of a few pieces of fruit with flies flying around them and some food leftover from some unknown time. This is not a snack and breakfast bar. I'm pretty sure that this hotel has spent more money on their advertisements and pictures of the breakfast bar than they spend on food for it for five years. The pictures presented online are not what is presented at the hotel. We actually did not eat at the "snack and breakfast" bar at all because I worried how long the food had been sitting out for with flies around it. The ramp towards our room was a complete fire hazard. I realize that this hotel is remodeling, but there was literally junk everywhere. Laundry baskets of random tools and materials littered the hallway and the smell was terrible. Our room smelled of mold and mildew and the "clean" towels smelled terrible as well. The TV did not work, as well as the hairdryer. Overall, the room was so dirty that I laid down my own blanket on the bed to sleep on. The view from the room was nice and it was a good location, but overall, I felt very unsafe and felt my room and the hotel was very dirty. The pink blankets in the room had to be greater than 40 years old and smelled about that old as welll. As we were leaving in the middle of the afternoon, we decided to take the stairs down rather than the elevator. About halfway down the stairs, there was a man laying on the stairway floor, wearing only jeans, sweating, shaking and swearing. I'm not sure why there are "security cameras" all over the hotel if random people are going to be sleeping in the stairwells and the hotel management is not going to do anything about it. After checking in, I almost was willing to give up the money I paid for three nights just to stay somewhere else. Unfortunately, this was not in my travelling budget and I was unable to switch to another hotel. I would never stay in this hotel again and am troubled that I spent as much money as I had staying there. The "lounge" in the back of the hotel was also littered with random junk, which is the only word that I can think of to describe it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a day, NOT for 3”
Reviews.Author: cottonsheets2
Reviews.Content: I'm puzzled by the hugely discrepant reviews of this hotel. I'm sitting in my room at Hotel Continental as I write this, and can only imagine that the rooms themselves must be hugely discrepant. This one, Room 378, is the pits. As per Rick Steves, we asked for a quiet room in the back and got a tiny (and I mean tiny) hole in the wall with a smelly bathroom. It's claustrophobic. Once we got the air conditioner going and the ceiling fan on, it was more bearable. The bathrooms were never really cleaned the entire 3 days (today is our last day) -- the towels were replaced though. Not that that helped - the pink towels have grey spots on them and stink like hell even if "fresh". If they were the standard white hotel towels, they'd look totally unacceptable. The free food bar is a little overrated. While I appreciate the breakfast rolls, fresh fruit, and beer, nothing else can be eaten beyond one meal. It's the same food for every meal. So the Euro 90 we spent on the room, thinking that it would save us money on the food, only saved us a bit. The real advantage to the hotel is its location and its free wifi in the rooms, as far as I'm concerned. If you can do a little research on Barcelona and find a hotel further away from La Rambla, you'd be just fine. This hotel has almost ruined our Barcelona experience... not quite though.

Reviews.Title: “location and having food made it worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Jmenn
Reviews.Content: It was nice having food and drink available constantly, especially after a few days of the small Euro coffees and pricy food compared to America. The staff was friendly and accommodating and no problems with internet availability. The rooms were pink.. verrry pink and frilly. The water was hot fast, and price hit the spot.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a real DUMP”
Reviews.Author: RobertBelmar_NJ
Reviews.Content: Hotel is rated 3* but is hardly a one star. It is the worst hotel room by any standard--torn carpet, tiles cracked and missing in the bathroom, rubbermaid furniture (really), musty smell, and very run down. The only plus is the location on Las Ramblas, but other better hotel options are available.

Reviews.Title: “good value, perfect position”
Reviews.Author: sammymalagaspain
Reviews.Content: This is a three star basic hotel. The entrance is very disappointing and highly inconvenient when the lift is out of order (as it was for two days of our stay) as you then have fifty stairs to negotiate. It is however perfectly located on Las Ramblas. The breakfast is adequate and what other hotel gives you unlimited 24hour free beer, wine and food buffet!!. Plenty of hot water and good bathroom but towels like sandpaper. Beds very high and hard, but confortable. Room a good size but terrible decor. We had a terrace overlooking Las Ramblas which was perfect for watching the world go by but noisy, free earplugs supplied when F.C.Barcelona won. Some building work was going on while we were there but no problem. Staff very knowledgeable and helpfull. All in all very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbymark
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel one night before our cruise and one night after. We had a balcony room on the second floor the first night and a much larger room with two beds on our return. We heard noise up to about ten and once we closed down the shutter we did not hear any more. We enjoyed the drinks that were included and also the ice cream. We would definately stay there again. We had our notebook with us and we were able to connect to the interent for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: travel343
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and loved every minute. We had a Ramblas balcony view which made things that much better. We were on the third floor and the street noise was loud all night. A set of ear plugs helped. The rooms are very pink and outdated, but comfortable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The 24 hour beer/wine/coffee/water/food bar was great. It was perfect to pop in every now and then and grab some water, a quick snack or a beer. The computer access was also appreciated. The hotel has a very central location that can't be beat. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: djburt2
Reviews.Content: We really loved staying at this hotel. It was so cute, and have recommended others to stay there. We had a large group, and everything was great. Loved the morning buffet and the beverages. The reception staff was the best, even though we were obnoxious travelers from California. It sure was a long flight, and we had a good time with the sangria. Cant wait to go back again in a few years. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel in ideal location with great services and staff”
Reviews.Author: laluna1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 15 year old daughter in this funny little hotel for three nights. Fab location in the center of town, La Rambla. Street theatre crazy markets selling chickens and all sorts. Yes the rooms are dated in decor and gave us many laughs as we giggled about the wall papered walls/lampshades & fans but we loved it there. Its central location makes it great for shopping and eating out. Make sure your back by 8-8.30. do as the energy changes and becomes unsafe after that time watch your bags at all times and treat it like central london. i was luck to have a great guide book with maps (Eyewitness Travel top 10 barcelona) got it off ebay for £5 invaluable! and it made our trip, planning the day before, what we would do the next day. Trains are so easy to work out if you get a map from Tourist information located in huge square on right of this hotel they will help you plan your trip. We didnt bother with the tourist buses for 21 euros a day we just jumped on the trains for 1.35 euros each way and weaved our way round using our map. Dont get ripped off eating on the rambla in the tappas bars find a recommended restuarant in your guide or try, la fresca theres a few around where you can eat all you like for 7.95 euros each (lunchtime- 9.99 euros in the evening) salad, soups, pasta,pizza,chicken, icecream,cake,drinks, loved it. Anyway back to the hotel dont get too excited about the buffet but the on tap beer/wine/fizzies/teas/coffees/water is a bonus to the hotel. Toast and cakes ok but not to our taste we prefered to go to the famous fruit/veg/meat market ( mercat de boqueria -left outside hotel & opposite) you can miss it so ask at reception. they sell a wide range of fruit smoothies for a euro fab energy boost for the day. The staff at the hotel were helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable the beds very comfy if you prefer a firmer mattress, we did. some say their rooms was small but ours was just right. We loved it and its true, all we want to do now is go back. Computor in lobby shared by the guests, internet connection in each room, fridge, microwave,hairdryer. Clean towels toilet roll each day. All the little extras made our stay a pleasant one. Surperb location, great value in an expensive city. Highly recommended. Oh yes lastly turn right out of hotel and walk straight up onto Rambla de catalunya. walk straight for a good half a mile and number 102 Mauri is the name- its on the right and is the best cake shop in town where you can sit and drink tea and eat sanwiches with the crusts off with the very rich. Our bill was 11 euros for two exquisite cakes, a pot of earl grey and a cappicino, worth every penny was a real treat. A wonderful experience and the shops that line the streets as you walk allow your mind to enter into another world. you,ll need the walk back to burn off the calories. Cant wait to plan the trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, Great location , Reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tsvi
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Barcelona , and stayed in this hotel. It has a perfect location , just in the middle of the city. The hotel is clean, our room had a nice bathroom, the staff are very polite and nice, the 24H buffet is great. The only samll drawback of this hotel , is that the rooms are not big. If you are not a ware of it you might find yourself in a small room , that might be too small for you. But I had a nice surprise - after check in , we saw the room that we've reserved, and found it too small for us. I went back to the reception and asked to check , maybe they have a bigger room , it took her few minutes to check, and than she told me that they will move us to a bigger room , and although it cost more they will not charge us for that . I really have nothing but good words to say on this nice hotel. During the whole week that we've stayed there we really enjoyed the hotel , as many other people that were in the hotel, aat the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there again, this time even better!!!”
Reviews.Author: vincethewanderer
Reviews.Content: I recently took my family again for our spring break to Barcelona, Spain. Whenever I have been there, I always stay at Hotel Continental Barcelona, and I am really satisfied with it. However, this time was even better, they have an awesome brand new reception on the second floor (first in Spain), not to mention the 24-hour free dinner buffett they offer. The new rooms overlooking the Ramblas are both gorgeous and confy. All improvements have been thoroughly studied and they turned out wonderful, without losing the personal style they used to have. For our second week, we tried the other hotel they have Hotel Continental Palacete, just a five-minute-walk away. The luxury - just for a few more dollars - is totally worth it. Vince Morera Martinsville, VA

Reviews.Title: “Small and European”
Reviews.Author: travelbug1952
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, if your never stayed in a small European hotel be prepared. It was as we expected, small rooms with own bathroom. Ideal location, close to harbour front, Picasso museum, and many other city sites. Breakfast was true Continental with choices of cereals, juices, milk, coffee, some hot choices, toast, hardboiled eggs, etc. Wine and beer is free on tap, bottled you have to pay for. We had an enjoyable time staying there. If you need a taxi ask the front and they will call one for you. If heading on a cruise it cost only 12 Euros to get to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “This great little hotel made a HIT with us!”
Reviews.Author: lambs2
Reviews.Content: AMAZING place right at the head of Las Ramblas by Catalunya Square! We had booked a room with a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas for two nights after our 21 day Med cruise. What a great choice!! After 21 days on a cruiseship we were perfectly contented to just eat the food at the hotel's 24/7 buffet, which we hear has been expanded in recent months. Before the cruise we had two days and tried local restaurants, tapas, etc. At the Hotel Continental there was always crereal, bread, cookies, dried and fresh fruit, peanuts, walnuts and soft serve ice milk with 3 topping choices! (DH especially LOVED this as he thinks ice cream is one of the main food groups!!) They also had soda, orange juice, white and rosa wine and beer available free 24/7 too, along with coffee, hot tea and cappachino!!! AND I saw hard boiled eggs every time I checked the buffet. Also a salad bar with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, olives, green peppers, and oil and vinegar for dressing - and surely some things I missed listing. Oh yea, they had some kind of cold reddish fish on it that I once accidentally thought was another bin of tomatoes!! They also had some hot dishes like paella (rice with veggies), some delicious white fish from time to time, veggies, and a potato stew. Even a nice ham pasta salad that was very tasty! Variety stayed fairly constant, too, though better when there was someone there actually preparing and cooking. We were VERY impressed, and found out that the eating facilities had been recently moved from a higher floor to the brand new reception area where there is a front breakfast room and a back (by the drink and ice milk machines) two row seating area. You could also use a back way up yo your floor and not have to go through the automatic doors each and every time. It took a bit of ingenuity to figure out how to do this (you go through the old empty breakfast area), but we liked this way to and from the reception area. The free internet access after the exhorbitant costs on the cruise ship was WONDERFUL! They have one computer by the food place that we got to use several times! Our room had a nice hard bed that was good for our backs, and a newly installed automatic black out shade over the glass doors to the balcony. Really cut our any light from Las Ramblas plus cut down on noise. Nice addition! Very clean "pink" room and bath. We enjoyed our stay there IMMENSELY, especiallyy sitting out on our balcony at night with a glass of wine and "people watching"! We used the convenient Aero bus to get to the airport on the morning we had to leave. It is just a short walk around the corner to the far side of Catalunya square and you can roll your luggage there with no problem. The Aerobus now charges €4.5 pp and is so very convenient! We most heartily recommend the wonderful Hotel Continental!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for The Money”
Reviews.Author: Chica14
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after reading the reviews on Travel advisor. We sayed here in November for 3 nights before our Trans-atlantic cruise to New York City. The hotel has a very good location. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast, which consists of juices, coffee, tea, cereals, fruits and rolls is an added plus. Also beer and bottled water are complimentary. The rooms are very pink, but comfortable and very clean. We had a balcony room overlooking Las Ramblas, which was pretty noisy at night. The rooms had a small refrigerator and a safe. We were pleased with the price and the service. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good - with reservations”
Reviews.Author: kcl491
Reviews.Content: One night stay after a Mediterranean cruise. Plenty of other US guests we met were staying either before or after a cruise. Pros: Location, location, location. Half block from Plaza Catalunya with the airport and HOHO busses. Right in the heart of the city. Can't be beat. The 24 hr availability of beverages and snacks. Great concept and we took advantage of it. We arrived at the hotel around 8:45 AM - couldn't check in until 1 PM but we were invited to take advantage of the food for breakfast. Very friendly staff. The room has a small fridge and microwave and there are several food shops (the basement of El Corte Ingles and a small Carrefour store) nearby so if you were planning a long stay you could have several meals in your room. Cons: To be courteous, the hotel is "old fashioned". Really, it's a quasi-dump. The hallway carpet is squares of carpet-tile haphazardly placed over really, really old frayed carpet. The carpeted floor of our room looked like it hadn't been vacuumed since Franco was in power. The beds were so hard both my husband and I had backaches the next day. If this is a three star hotel in Spain, it would probably be a one star in the US. Would we stay here again. Absolutely, only because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: SLN209
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before & the night after our Med cruise. We reserved a room with a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas & enjoyed it greatly. The staff were very kind & helpful. The all-day breakfast and free water & sodas were a nice bonus. We were able to use their computer & got our boarding passes before leaving for the airport. Would highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Shy2Fly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Continental in October 2008. The set up is quite strange in that there are three hotels in the one block (like a converted apartment block). Floor 2 is Hotel Continental. Stepping out of the lift, the carpet was grim, the corridor not decorated. Taking an immediate left you are greeted by a heavy door. This leads you to the lobby. I say lobby. More like a small room. The staff were polite, but quite standoffish. No one showed us to our room, we were given a key and told - down the corridor to your left. The couple behind us were then checked in. The room was small. The size of a standard master bedroom, same with the ensuite. The room was clean. However the decor (pink walls, pink ceiling (!), pink bedspread, dark carpet, dark curtain and cream net curtain) was definately outdated. The balcony was small but had a terrific view of La Ramblas - the main street in the area. The all day breakfast (included in the price) was a great bonus, and there was a generous selection of food. The location of this hotel was what drew me to it. Directly on La Ramblas, you are at the heart of hustle and bustle of the city. The marina to you left (approx 5 minute walk), and a bus tour centre location to your right (approx 2 minute walk). There is a great pizzaria next door to the hotel, and the hard rock café is out of the hotel, follow the road to the right, and right again (opposite the fountains) - approx 2 mins away. In all, I would stay here again - the location of this hotel cannot be beaten. If you are looking for modern, do not book here. If you are looking for somewhere to rest your head after a day sightseeing, then this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice ~ Great Value for a Single Female Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Reneyap
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay at the Hotel Continental by an ex-colleague and it was an absolutely correct move. I paid under 80euros/night (as it was winter and prob a low-peak period and the daily breakfast was a blessing to those with a shoestring travelling budget. They even have free wireless internet! For those w/o a laptop can opt to use the free PC at the counter. There is no new items for the breakfast buffet but i can't complain as it's really good value for the amt that i am paying. Know what i did? I brought along cup noodles and milk chocolate sachets for days that i needed to have comfort food from home. There are also fruits at the buffet like apples, tomatos. The reception staff are always friendly and warm - and some are even trilingual! Housekeeping is done everyday, and fresh towels provided daily but sheets aren't changed everyday - but it didn't bother me at all. I would definitely stay @ the hotel continential if i go back to Barcelona ~ :)

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap but what a dump”
Reviews.Author: clifthouse
Reviews.Content: The room we had for my family was tiny. The review I read said that the rooms were small, but this was ridiculous. The room itself was clean and the bathroom was the nicest thing about the room. The hallway was a DUMP. The hallway carpet was filthy. I took the elevator to the street and my wife and kids walked down the stairs, only to find a homelss person asleep in the stairwell. Not exactly the way we wanted to end our Spanish vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: WillowNorthWest
Reviews.Content: We had read all about the weird decor, we'd read all about the 24hr buffet and we'd read all about the location location location. What we didn't expect was the 5 star attitude of the staff. We were warmly welcomed at reception, our room was ready (at 10am), the front desk staff were knowledgeable and always very helpful, and the domestic staff were unobtrusive and did a great job. I would definitely recommend a stay here. I would have liked to have seen some ham and cheese at the breakfast buffet, as 3 days on eggs and tomatoes can lead to the possibilities of ..... well that's not something to go into here, but, we strolled to the local supermercado and bought a pack of cheese and ham for less than 2 Euro and, having stored them in the in-room refrigerator, had one morning of majestic breakfasting!! Viva El Continental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Sheppard
Reviews.Content: Great Location - On Ramblas itself just down from Cataluyna Plazza. Good value for money. Room average size, bed comfy. Bathroom average - not cramped. Had a rear of hotel room so didnt get any street noise, was on the dark side, but as i wasnt getting in until 2 or 3 am it wouldnt have mattered and only used the room to shower and sleep. Aircon great and was necessary - 30c during day in the shade and 24c at midnight!. Strange really old fashioned decor and covers on furniture, but all adding to a rather strange charm. Buffet style breakfast - mainly consisting of bread, fruit juice coffee, boiled eggs and cereals. No cooked stuff such as sausages or bacon. But absolutely fine. Great city, lots to do. Dont take any valuables out with you where at all possible, just leave them in your room safe at night. I would post some pictures except I had my camera stolen (pick pocketed) on the second night. They probably thought it was my wallet, but all my cash was double pinned in the lower pockets of ny shorts. I think they used the old diversion tactic of brushing againt you so that you notice them knocking into you, while they help themselves to the contents of your pocket. Still had a good holiday though.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Central location”
Reviews.Author: sanddy
Reviews.Content: My four friends and I have just returned from an extended weekend break in Barcelona staying at the Continental Hotel. For anyone wanting a modern or trendy hotel then this is possibly not the one for you, there are plenty of newer ones around, however if you are looking for a modest and clean hotel, with friendly service then you will not get better. The hotel is 'shabby chic' at its best, offering excellent value for money and you could not get a better location if you want to be central. The small balconies offer the perfect place to sit and watch the world go by right in the heart of the city. We were in Barcelona for 2 nights but 3 days so needed somewhere to put our luggage after checking out, there is a secure luggage room that allows you to keep everything there with peace of mind that it is safe. The complimentary refreshments are a life saver, the temparature over the weekend touched the 100s so the cool bottled water that was always availabke was well recieved, as was the fresh coffee,. I would certainly recommend hotel this for short city breaks and will not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: lIuv2trvl36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for three nights prior to a cruise we were taking. In my opinion the hotel is a great value. We had an inside room that was very small. The room was clean, and we were able to check in early (10am), That allowed us a full day to sightsee. Probably the biggest plus factor was the location. The hotel is at the top of La Rambla. and only a short (2blocks) walk from the main bus boarding area. The airpost shuttle bus completes its run here and is the best way to get into the city a lso the boarding point for the double decker city tour bus is also very close by. The breakfast buffet is available all day. We paid less than 90 euros per night and at that rate it was a great bargain. One last comment regarding Barcelona. Its a wonderful place but heed the warning about pickpockets. They are very skilled and in my opinion you must be very , very careful. I thought I was but it turned out i wasn't careful enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kgjordan417
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started out 16 day European journey in Barcelona and 2 nights at Hotel Continental. We took the bus from the airport which dropped us off a block away from the hotel. Located right on Las Ramblas the hotel is in a great location! When we got to the hotel our room was available, even though it was only 10a.m. so we were grateful for that. In order to beat jet lag we dropped our stuff off in the room and headed back out for the day and fought through the sleepiness, IT WORKED!!!!!!! They were very friendly at the front desk. There was a cooler of free sodas and water, plus breakfast and snacks out all day in the lobby. Our room was great and quirky, fairly small, bold green carpet, pink walls, plastic furniture, but a huge bathroom! Bottom line, the bed was comfortable and that's all we cared about! There was an issue with out balcony door, which they fixed immediately and it is important to know how that you have to put your key in the device on the wall to get the electricity to work! Overall, it was a great way to start our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: MrsWooBrighton
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable bargain in the centre of everything. The free buffet was outstanding and our bedroom was as comfy as anything. We advised them it was our wedding anniversary and they left a lovely bottle of cava in our room for our arrival. I will return there, with my husband, as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for three ladies”
Reviews.Author: Gurion
Reviews.Content: Lovely stay one night before cruise. Right in the middle of everything, near the Mercat, near the Placa Catalanya, very close to the El Corte Ingles. Taxi site is a few meters up the street. Had a lovely night in the area around Santa Maria del Mar, a short taxi drive away. Everything is neat and clean. And very pink and feminine. The safes were working perfect and were easy to use. The staff really friendly and helpful. The taxi driver from the airport had'nt heard of the hotel, probably because of a modest entrance and the fact that the hotell is located in the third floor. So keep the street adress in order to go there. We will definately go back, certainly with girl friends and women in my family, this is a pink and flowery, feminine place. I take my sons and husband back in july, then we are staying a few meters away, at the Citadines.

Reviews.Title: “Loving IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: mortijon
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, right on the Ramblas. Little balcony overlooking the Ramblas, ideal to watch the world go by. Very quaint and old fashioned hotel. decor is amazingly odd. Room comfortable but small. All amenities right in the centre. Fab all day buffet, with free beer and water. For the price this is the best central location. My teenage daughter thought it was cool!! despite the curtain between the bedroom and bathrom. Microwave and fridge in your room means snacks are cheap and cheerful. If you want a high class hotel this is not for you, but for good central accomodation that doesn't cost the earth this is the one. Staff are very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great for first-time Barcelona visit!”
Reviews.Author: reh2os
Reviews.Content: The location alone is worth the price I paid for the three nights I was there. This was my first visit to Barcelona and it certainly helped that I was in close proximity to many attractions, tour options, and shopping and food. When I first walked into the hotel, it looked dark and outdated but the room and bed turned out to be quite comfortable, the service very pleasant, and the breakfast/snack buffet a big plus, not to mention the complimentary spring water and sodas. I also felt very safe with the hotel being on two levels high above the infamous Rambla. Noise was never a problem even if parts of the hotel were under renovation. One complaint I had was the slow bathtub drain on the last night. I completely forgot to mention it upon checkout the next morning. When Rick Steves wrote (in his Spain 2008 guidebook) about the hotel decor and the "Tupperware drawers", I sort of knew what to expect. And I ended up not being disappointed. I would stay at this hotel again if not for the fact that I do want to sample and explore the other neighborhoods of this exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “its all in the location”
Reviews.Author: mixeblob
Reviews.Content: Me and my 2 friends stayed here last October for 3 nights,just taken a while to getting round to writing the review!! Anyway,this was a treat for me as i was on holiday on my own,leaving husband and 2 small children at home,so it was a much needed break!!We checked in at about 10.30 pm and were given our keys and instructions to our in room safes,my room wasnt a bad size,queen bed and a nice bathroom,however,from the minute i walked into my room i noticed a really horrible false smell,if you know what i mean,i dont know if it was the a.c but it was not nice,and sooo strong.Anyway,one of my friends was upstairs and her room was much bigger than mine! and my other friends room was the smallest,it was very small,but neither of theirs had the horrible smell that i had.So,we put our bags in and went straight out,i was really shocked at how busy it was,we had been warned about pick pockets and kept our bags tight to our bodies,i did feel a little unsafe to begin with but soon got used to it.There are some great restaraunts nearby,some that were stupidly expensive and some very reasonable,on the whole eating and drinking was much cheaper than i thought it would have been.Hard rock cafe,tour buses and shops just round corner,so the location was perfect.Also i must tell you and you must go,we were desperate to see real Flamenco and considdered going to the restaraunt over the road,cant remember the name,but it was something ridiculouse like 90 euros for dinner and show which we thought was too much,we asked at the reception of the hotel who were extremely helpfull and directed us to Las Tarantos,i think it was in the plaza(great big square 5 minutes walk away with loads of restaraunts and bars etc).Anyway,the show started at 8 i think but we were told to arrive early which we did.The place itself was very tucked away,we had been sitting opposite it the night before and hadnt realised it was there!!!But it was beautifull,vrrrery small and dark with little round tables and Gaudi style seating areas,you get the picture!!!It was lovely.The show was just fantastic and at 6 euros,you cant knock,but i cant tell you enough how fantastic it was,it was breathtaking,no touristy stuff,just proper flamenco with fantastic music and singing,my friends and i went for pizza after and loved it that much that we went in again for the last show,its even cheeper second time round at 4 euros!!!Anyway,im getting eye ache now,but the hotels location was good and the buffet was very handy and staff very helpfull,as mentioned by someone else,the hallways are pretty bad,just dont look down and spry lots of perfume in your room!!!For the price we paid it was very good and easy for sightseeing,but you must make sure you go to Las Tarantos,it made our holiday!!!Ive since found out it is the oldest Flamenco bar in Barcelona....that explains everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs and wear a blind-fold”
Reviews.Author: sunfunmom
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on Rick Steve's review in his Spain 2008 book. His review is mostly spot-on except for one detail. The noisy plumbing. The plumbing (sound of water constantly running) is louder and more annoying than the street noise from Las Ramblas. My husband and I booked a one week stay at this hotel and we were ready to leave after Day 2. We ended up staying the entire week because we couldn't find another affordable hotel (we paid 122 euros a night and the other hotels were quoting 200+ euros/nt). The location is excellent. In the end, I would recommend this hotel only to those who don't care about staying in a hotel with old decor, sitting on plastic chairs, and can sleep through any noise. I bought ear plugs and that helped a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pyper1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 days in March after a cruise. We went on a city tour and was let out about a half a block from the hotel so we did not need to use a taxi to get from the docks. The location could not be better, right by the tourist bus and the metro. There is a Hard Rock around the corner and large department stores close by. The hotel was clean and I felt very safe. The staff was excellent. They were very helpful and friendly. This is a small older hotel but for the price could not be better. I would stay there again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 Star maybe 1 Star”
Reviews.Author: MB1Europe
Reviews.Content: What can I say, location wise it is very good, but hotel wise it is terrible. On the plus side you get free water, beer and breakfast, on the negative it is very run down, rooms are terrible, plastic furniture, Bed is rock solid, rooms smell, Rooms / Hallways are awful. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ajie
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great- at the top of La Rambla, literally a 5 min walk from the airport bus that costs 4.50 euros each way. The sightseeing bus is a 3 min walk at Plaza Catalunya.The hotel's decor is very unique and dated but charming. This is a very basic one star hotel similar to a guest house.The beds have foam mattresses.The english speaking staff is very helpful and it is rare to find any hotel offering 24hrs snacks, sodas, beer and bottled water for free. There is also a computer available for guests use and it is free. We booked a balcony room overlooking La Rambla. This was great for people watching but with the door closed you could still hearing the rowdy revelers at 2am. Would not recommend balcony room for light sleepers. Good value for money. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Locations, Locations, Locations!”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitiExpat
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through online agent, and being family with 2 young children, as usual booked a triple room for three. Turns out the hotel have a policy of maximum allowable number of people in one room - but was resolved, and we were helped by adding a mattress. With the price we're paying, we expected a teeny-tiny room with a broomcloset-like bathroom/shower as with other hotels in Europe. I braced myself for having to do acrobatic tricks while taking a shower to cope with the cramped quarters. The room was quite small but not as small as the ones we had in London hotels with the same price, and found - surprise, surprise! - a (small) full bathroom with bathtub, that even have a bidet! It's true that the decors are too pinkish and "flowery" for my taste but who wants to stay in their hotel room and stare at the wall for too long in lively Barcelona? Furnitures are cloth covered plastic - but we only use them to dump our backpacks on when we were sleeping anyway! We opted for a room overlooking the Ramblas and we're glad we did. The view was magnificent and if you want you can stay for hours looking at the passing crowd and street performers below. Locations is everything for a hotel. Continental Barcelona is at the North end of Las Ramblas, only a few yards away from Plaza Catalunya, Barri Gothic, Metro, El Corte Ingles Dept. Store, Carreour Express, the stop for Barcelona Tour Bus and endless shops along Las Ramblas. Hard Rock Cafe and Starbucks is just around the corner so this one has a perfect location to start your adventure in Barcelona! Being family with children, we love the convenience of having the 24 hour snack and drinks at the hotel. No more rushing to the supermarket for evening milk for the kids while we were there! On Christmas day they even handed out free champagne for guests! The staff are very friendly, polite and helpful and they will go out of their way to make things work for you. Cristina, Peter and others at the front desk will make sure you have all that you need, and help out with enquiries on what to see and where to go in the city, even handed out the brochures for some of the local attractions. They were very helpful and caring, and help with taxi orders even after we have checked out from there! We will definitely stay there again the next time we visit Barcelona after our experience with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Miami_Cruiser
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights in Barcelona after our cruise and we chose to stay at the Hotel Continental on Las Ramblas due to the location and price. WORD OF ADVICE.....DON'T!!!! First the positive.... Honestly the only positive things I can say about the hotel are the fact that you get free soft drinks, water and beer while you are there and the location is a plus. The reality.... -The rooms were tiny -The rooms were worn and out-dated -The furniture pieces were plastic rubbermaid organizers with a metal sheet on top to create a table. -The bathroom was a little moldy and the cold water was not coming into the shower on the first night. The bathroom itself is bad enough, but the fact that I had to bathe in boiling water is ridiculous. -There were two small towels and two bath towels. No hand towels, tub mat, washcloth or anything of the sort. -Couldn't turn off the heater, so we opted for regulating the temperature with the amount of air coming in from the window -The bed was hard as a rock -The pigeons outside our window would not let us sleep -Getting the toilet to flush toilet paper was a 1/2 hour ordeal -The key was attached to a ruler, so everyone would leave their keys at the front desk in order not to have to carry the thing all day -The maid smelled so bad you could smell her all the way down the hall and around the corner. Word of advice....pay a little more so you can rest and enjoy your stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ktpc2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel one night before our cruise. We arrived at 11:30am after our overnight flight from Boston via Heathrow and were able to check in right away. We had a balcony room, which was a good size for Europe. The room were a little worn but they are functional and fit the purchase. The balcony was real nice to sit out on and eat breakfast in the morning. The buffet was great and we were able to stock up on drinks for our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Two stays and altho cramped...”
Reviews.Author: daryleann
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I decided convenience in location would win over 'decor.' I am so glad I booked it! We got the 'last room' available, as there was a cruise ship leaving. We met several other cruisers there, both before and after the cruise. Our first room (2 nites) was near the elevator shaft and one review said it might be noisy. Not a bit!! The new windows blocked out every sound. Huge bathroom - altho the tub is soooo high! Trouble for this old lady. After the cruise we got a smaller room - (and bathroom was smaller) but there was still fresh air as it had a "porch" where we could stick the luggage (altho it was so short a time we didn't bother.) Since the 24/7 buffet closes about 4 am, we were concerned as we had a 4:30 taxi, but the guy let us get something and did his stocking a bit early to accommodate us. So nice!! Metro was a short distance and we were able to travel all over town, as well as get the train to Monserrat . Super choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: tessuli
Reviews.Content: Hotel Continental is absolutely fantastic. Location is fantastic, rooms are quiet on the not-Ramblas side, free snacks, absolutely polite and charmfull reseption.. Everything is great for the price you pay. The Rooms are a bit worn out, but so what. There is so much to see in Barcelona that you don't sit in your room looking at the walls. Rooms are spotless and there is air conditioning and heating. For that price I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European style hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SKG_7
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel that is centrally located. If you want luxury, don't stay here. However, if you are looking for a clean hotel with a helpful staff, this is the place to stay. Rooms at the front have a balcony that overlooks La Rambla. When the balcony door is open, it is noisy, but shutting the door blocks out most of the noise. The air conditioning was very good, and both of our rooms had a ceiling fan. The rooms were small by American standards, but their size was adequate. If you don't want to bring a computer, there is one at the front desk for quickly checking email. The staff was wonderful. The free soft drinks and bottled water saved us time and money, and the all-day snack/breakfast area allowed us to grab a quick bite to eat before we went out each day. There was also free beer and, for a small fee, bottles of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sevast
Reviews.Content: I believe Hotel Continental is a specialty. Located in the heart of the Gothic quarter it is a very good base for walking tours. I guess the rooms can be small for Americans but we thought they were O.K. (We have seen a lot more worse). Even the size of the room is small it has everything you need-a pretty functional room. Our room even had a microvawe which we did not use as we always ate out. One other great thing about the hotel was the free snack bar open 24 hours a day. I will definately be staying there again if I ever go to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: DAMC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this month and was very impressed. Do not be put off when you enter the reception area (2nd floor of building) as it looks a little shabby, with worn carpets and wallpaper beginning to peel off. This only adds to the charm of the hotel. The location is it's outstanding feature being on The Ramblas and only 30 yards from Plaza Catalunya. This makes it so easy to get around the city (nearest subway is 20 yards away). The rooms are small but functional and I wouldn't bother with the breakfast but there are plenty of cheap cafe's around where you can get a good breakfast. The staff are friendly and helpful and there is free internet access, soft drinks and beer. If you're thinking of coming to Barcelona, give this place serious considertaion.

Reviews.Title: “only the best”
Reviews.Author: italyalways
Reviews.Content: Funky, historic, right on the Rambla AND free drinks, snacks and breakfast AND internet. Why stay anywhere else. [--]

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Heather26
Reviews.Content: good location, but ask for a room overlooking the street for the best rooms. We had a very small inside room which was very shabby. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.The breakfast is available all day and complimentary soft drinks too, which makes it very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: momof3kids20
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 2 seperate stays - Pre and Post Cruise. ROOMS - The rooms are typical European size. The hotel is currently being renovated, and the rooms are in much better shape than the hallways. The rooms have excellent A/C, something not all hotels have, very thick mattress, but somewhat on the hard side. The bathroom was modern, and had excellent water pressure and hot water. There is a blow dryer and a small TV. The rooms are very quaint. STAFF - I can not say enougth good things about the staff, they are very helpful, can tell you how to find anything around town, and will go an extra mile to help you. They provided us with a fan, because we forgot our small one, and like to sleep with the white noise. They also kept our son's treasured blanket safe for him for 2 weeks, because he forgot and left it there while we where on our cruise. We asked for blankets, and they had them there in about 2 minutes. AMENITIES: They have an all day free drink and snack bar area. You can get soft drinks, bottled water, milk,muffins, cereal, toast, cookies, and boiled eggs at any time. They have a small dining area over lookingLa Rambles, that has a wonderful breeze blowing in all the time. They also have free wireless internet. LOCATION; The location can't be beat. It is at the top of La Rambles, and about 2 minutes from Catalunya Square. You can walk, catch the tourist bus or subway, or be at the biggest deparment store all within a couple of minutes. Hard Rock is right around the corner, Burger King and McDonalds are across the street, if you want a taste of the USA. Tapas and shopping are right there. OVERALL: A wonderfully friendly and helpful staff with a great location, good AC, and a modern bathroom. We would recommend it to anyone, but those who are seeking an elegant or really special experience.

Reviews.Title: “good basic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tcleaner
Reviews.Content: I try to get to barcelona once or twice a year to watch a bit of football and after stumbling across this hotel on the guardian travel website a few years ago always stay here. the location is ideal, 3 minutes walk from placa catalunya where the aerobus terminates. staff are friendly and speak excellent english. rooms are basic but clean. beds are fine, showers are hot. 110 euros a night will get you a room overlooking the ramblas and you can help yourself to beer and soft drinks for free. breakfast is also included. this is nothing special, basically toast, cereal, hard boiled eggs, kiwis and coffee or orange juice, all self service. i stay here with friends and i love it, but if i was travelling with a partner who i was trying to impress i may go elsewhere. they have a sister hotel in the eixample which is slightly more expensive but better for couples

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SSmith40
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day stay at the hotel and we had a great time. One of the best things about this hotel was the central location. I would recommend booking a room with a balcony on Las Ramblas - great for people watching whilst partaking in a free beer! The free soft drinks/ beer and buffet were super value. Although the decor was unusual the rooms were clean and staff were very helpful. We will definitely stay here the next time we visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Raesonable price but shabby decor”
Reviews.Author: ThomasGCanada
Reviews.Content: Reasonable prices and helpful staff. Unfortunately rooms and decor are very shabby. Also fairly noisy. Entrance to hotel is rather strange. Hotel will suffice if you are strapped for funds.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT! March 15-17,07”
Reviews.Author: BSV1823
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Las Ramblas close to the train station, bus station and in the heart of Barcelona. The decor wasn't the best and the rooms were small but the beds were comfortable and it was clean. You had free sodas and water and 24 hour snacks and free internet. We paid 80 Euros for 2 people and you can't beat the price. The staff was very nice and suggested many places to eat and what areas not to miss. It was a wonderful stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with friendly staff and lovely location...”
Reviews.Author: AdamStolarczyk
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel located in the very center place in Barcelona , recommended for everyone who want to be in the moddle of action :). Hotel is located centrally on Las Ramblas, very close to Placa Catalunya (about 20meters;). Not big, family hotel with 24 hours continental breakfast - what is really advantage of that hotel - 24 hours you have tost, bread, eggs, fruits, coffee, tea, juices, cold drinks (cola, cola light, tonic, water ) and beer :) - all unlimited :). Rooms in c specific style, but clean and quite comfortable with microvawe and fridge. That was my secodn stay in that hotel and will be definietly back :)

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Hotel Continental!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaBklyn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We moved from another (dreadful) hotel to the Continental and have nothing but great things to say about it! Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff at the front desk as well as in housekeeping. My boyfriend needed pants taken up and after searching all morning for a tailor, a nice lady in housekeeping volunteered to stay after her shift to do it. Breakfast bar and free drinks 24/7. These were welcome treats when we stopped in mid-day for a rest. The location absolutely cannot be beaten!!! Right on The Ramblas and less than a half-block from Plaza Catalonya. The rooms are cute as can be. Highly decorative with comfy beds. Very, very small, however, so be careful with kids or lots of luggage. Nice bathroom with big tub which made me a very happy traveler!

Reviews.Title: “more shabby than chic”
Reviews.Author: sugref
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed 3 star, I think 0.3 star was more like it. the decor was extremely shabby and the room very small. On the plus side the location is fab and the staff very helpfull, the breakfast stuff left out all day for you to help yourself any time and as often as you like, there was free beer and soft drinks in the lobby, The linen was changed daily so for the price it was reasonable just dont think you are getting anything near a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. value for money.”
Reviews.Author: tlaslo20
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel alone in October & while I cannot say the decoration was to my taste I can only highly recommend this for location, price, but above all for genorosity of food, water, help in every possible way to guests. It could not be better placed for seeing the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BagLadies
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed for two nights at this hotel. We all had balcony rooms overlooking Las Ramblas and yes it was noisy but shut the doors and incredible noise reduction. It was great to sit out and watch the comings and goings on the street. The staff are wonderful and always helpful. The free 24 hours non stop breakfast with free beer, soft drinks, tea and coffee was a very welcome treat after sightseeing. Would definately recommend this hotel, it was reasonable priced and a terrific location right in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “ok if your an insomniac”
Reviews.Author: rach41xxx
Reviews.Content: nightmare alley! ok if you dont need to sleep at night.the people next door felt like they were in the room with us.everytime they were walking around,the bed shuddered.the walls seemed as if they were made of cardboard.the staff member on arrival was very polite&helpfull.however,the night person on reception was the most rudest, hostile ,ignorant person i have ever met in my entire life.no eye contact,no smile,as if we were a right nuisance,when all we wanted was a bottle of wine opened!the rooms were clean,however in need of a total re-vamp.very old fashioned.the wallpaper has haunted me every day since.the breakfast was awful.dried cereal,apples,hard boiled eggs,coffee/tea in plastic cups.the whole experience,i found upsetting&to be honest,it ruined my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Un-Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: wcasey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 3 star ...but the truth is it is more like a pension or 1 star (if lucky). Basically it was a dump! The walls were really depressing between the dimed green/white paint job and the horrific black and red wall paper...and what was up with the pink bedrooms...we felt like we were in the twighlight zone or a bad nightmare. The internet never worked in our room. The bed spread was gross and the plastic furniture was a bit like sleeping in a dollar store...and don't me started on the foam matresses...there was no real bed...so the owners have bad taste...or are cheap...the good points were that the bathroom was clean and we got free drinks, the people were nice, and if the ramblas is what you want then the location was good...however the so-called buffet was not a plus because the croissants were bad, the milk tasted sour, and overall the cleanliness of this entire hotel was left to be seen....A HUGE DISAPOINTMENT! See attached photos!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyFL
Reviews.Content: So, it's not the Ritz, but you're not paying Ritz prices either. We stayed two nights here pre-cruise, August 16 and August 17. We were fortunate enough to have a balcony room and so had a great view of Las Ramblas and all of it's activity. Sure, it was noisy, although they have a nice sound filter shade that really helps keep some of the noise out late at night. We had no trouble sleeping. The furnishings are humble, quaint, bordering on tacky, but certainly functional. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning and it was fun meeting the other guests. Having free drinks any time and free internet access is a REAL plus. I must say that the staff were wonderful and very helpful. My husband's luggage was lost by the airlines and the front desk manager spent a lot of time on the phone trying to locate it for us. Unfortunately, we didn't see that suitcase until almost 3 weeks later when we returned home to Tampa after the cruise! This hotel has a GREAT location and is a real value for the $$. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabel_2
Reviews.Content: It’s location cannot be beat, right on Las Ramblas, 5 minutes from Placa Catalunya but still quite (in the room). Rooms were decent size, bathroom even large by European standards, everything spotlessly clean. There was a microwave, mini-fridge and hairdryer as well as AC, ceiling fan and a safe. Great desk staff. Cute hotel dog (a giant white dog named Cancunun). And a buffet of Danish, cereal, juice, fruit, coffee, etc that is available 24 HOURS A DAY! It was great to come back for a quick break (easy to do due to the location) and get a snack while there. Also free soda and bottled water. 85€ for a double.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Horrible! Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: kidhauler
Reviews.Content: Other than being in a good location this hotel was the worst. It was dirty, cramped and noisy! Just about every surface was covered in a horrible toile fabric. This awful fabric was covering plastic lawn furniture and even the dressers were plastic bins. The towels in the bathroom smelled bad and the shower was almost impossible to work and neither the hairdryer nor the TV worked. I stayed here three nights and hardly slept due to how noisy it was...it was like the other patrons were in our room with us! I would never stay here again. Even my husband who has backpacked through Europe was grossed out by this room.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: amyag
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Continental Barcelona with our two children before cruising. Not too many choices when traveling with 4. I'd been to Barcelona before and was concerned that this location might be too noisy. We had a room without balcony and never heard a sound from the streets. The location can't be beat! We arrived from the metro and saw our hotel right away. Though the room was a bit shabby, the children had a separate sleeping room and their own bathroom (both surprises). With the Barcelona heat, having free cold drinks (bottled water, bottled beer, botled soda) free, at our disposal was quite a treat. Even the breakfast was enjoyable. I've never tasted such a delicious orange juice, and the hard boiled eggs with the bright orange yolks were great. It appeared that they were refurbishing some of the rooms, though the presence of workers was not a problem, as they were always polite and only worked during daytime hours. I hope to return to Barcelona, and will certainly consider staying at the Hotel Continental Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Great Price- Wallpaper still haunts me in my dreams”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from the Continental - Our second consecutive stay in 2 years and my 4th visit to barcelona Firstly if arriving by taxi,from the airport, I would suggest asking the driver to take you to the Hard Rock Cafe (Placa Catalunya), A one minute walk to the hotel on Las Rablas but Barcelonas one way system will add about 8 euros to your fare if you ask to be dropped at the door. Dont be put off when you see the entrance and then the lift to the second floor to get in - This hotel has character Many reviewers have complained about the decor - Believe me it is interesting and requires much needed attention, By the end of a 1 week stay you will probably know how many Horses, Huntsmen, Birds etc there are on each wall.- If you want decor then check out its sister hotel (Palicette) further up the ramblas - (we went for a look round - paintings, chandeliers etc-) The rooms are clean but basic - I have only stayed in rooms with balcony overlooking las ramblas - I would not consider anything else as we tend to spend many hours sat on the balcony partaking of a beer and soft drink from the free 24hour drinks buffet, watching the 'life' of Las Ramblas. The Free continental buffet is still available 24hours - Mostly bread, pastries, tea/coffee/orange, The rooms have airconditioning, a safe (free of charge) and a fridge and microwave. , The hotel staff without exception were friendly and helpful For what is one of the best locations in the heart of Barcelona I dont believe this hotel can be beaten for the price (we paid 105 euro per night for our balcony room) However remember that you are staying on one of the main streets in the city - Although the double glazed balcony doors and thick curtains cut out a LOT of noise,, Barcelona is a 'Party' city - would not recomment this street if you want peace and quiet. We have booked again for next year - so much more of Barcelona to discover !

Reviews.Title: “Hats Off to Hotel Continental”
Reviews.Author: Resa-Travel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Continental sent me a letter in which they apologized for our “not so happy stay” in April (see review May 2, 2006). How they handled this is a remarkable gesture on their part, therefore Hats Off to Hotel Continental for trying to make things right.

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very Good location but very very very bad hotel. The breakfast was not good. Allot off noise from the pipe in the room. Very Noise room. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place, by NO means luxury!”
Reviews.Author: motovilova
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Continental for 1 night in August of 2005 after a cruise. We did not get a room with a balcony, because of the noise on Las Ramblas. The room was not the best, and those seeking luxury accomidations will be disappointed. By American standards I would say that this hotel is below (in rating) than a Hilton or a Sheraton. However, if you are looking for an average room in THE BEST location, this is your place! The continental breakfast was there all day, with a few extra items earlier in the morning. There were hard boiled eggs, tomatoes, juice, cereals, coffee, danishes, fruits, milk. I LOVED the hard boiled eggs (since in the US the food often lacks flavor, these were the best eggs I've ever had!!). Also free drinks and beer was available. The location was amazing, like I mentioned before, and once you step out of the front door, you are on a street that never sleeps. It is in the middle of everything. The staff was very nice and friendly. I would stay there again, no question. Besides, when you are in a city as wonderful as Barcelona, who needs a room for anything more than just sleep! There is so much to see there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location..”
Reviews.Author: kdwalter
Reviews.Content: This is a great three star hotel. The location is key, right in the heart of everything. The accomidations are just ok, but they do the job. The staff was nice and friendly. Breakfast and free internet included, plus... free beer! If you are a light sleeper, you may want to avoid the rooms on Las Ramblas. It was very loud all night, but personally this didn't bother me. All in all, great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent...good location”
Reviews.Author: CeePop
Reviews.Content: Excellent location on Las Ramblas, easy access to transportation. Ask for a recommendation of restaurants to eat at the front desk. Every selection we tried was very good. If you have time to plan in advance, write to the Spanish Embassy for walking tour guide pamphlet. We had 3 days there and followed the pamphlet - great way to see all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “I can't understand the complaints”
Reviews.Author: ronnifel
Reviews.Content: A little advance planning would remove this hotel from those looking for modern posh surroundings. However, if you would rather soak in some authentic charm, at a great location, this is your hotel. Why complain about old wallpaper? Do you prefer stark tan modern walls? Why complain about plastic drawers? Do you prefer bulky room-taking furniture? This place is high- ceilinged, ergonomically state of the art, not an extraneous element. Even the bedside lamps are suspended from the wall, to leave more space on the nightstands (one, the top of the safe) for YOUR possessions. The rooms have microwave ovens and refrigerators, so a short shopping trip to the basement supermarket of El Corte Ingles (a block away) will stock you with good bread, cheese, ham, olives, whatever, and a 1-euro bottle of wine, beer or soda from the lobby fridge completes an excellent late afternoon break, as you sit on your balcony and watch the sun set over La Rambla. This is in addition to the complimentary snack bar, with coffee, tea, pastries, prunes, etc., which remains open all day after the included open-til-noon continental breakfast. Try to get a third-floor room which muffles the dog's barking and any lobby noise. P.S. The floral sheets suspended from the hallway ceilings are obviously hiding the wiring that makes the rooms so efficient. Get a life!

Reviews.Title: “Trip Ruined”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona in June, 2004 and stayed at Hotel Continental La Rambla. The Hotel was disgusting, very outdated, including very old and dark wall paper, a fabric was hanging from the roof in place of ceilings??? it was totally disgusting. It smells like an old book store, moldy. We had dreamed of this trip to Spain and worked real hard to save the money for it. Staying at this hotel ruined our days in Barcelona. The furniture is disgusting, they had old plastic patio chairs and a plastic container with drawers for your clothes in the rooms, the carpet was old. Discolored old blankets and beds made one worry about sleeping in them. The breakfast bar was disgusting, stale. We had to go and spend more money buying breakfast outside. We had a balcony room at first, then switched to a regular room, they did not let us see it in advance and when we got moved to it, it was so small that we had to close our eyes in the room so not to become claustrophobic. The bed was stuck against a wall on one side and enough to get your feet out of bed only on the other. We hated every minute of it. No air conditioning. Noisy. Positives, location, frienly front desk staff, eveything else negative.We will never return to this hotel again. We finally left and stayed at Hotel Medicis and loved it. Nice, updated, clean rooms, friendly service and at a great price, almost half the price, it is near the Sagrada Familia Church. We will return to Medicis and to beautiful Barcelona. The city is a jewel, we highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Continental for 4 nights at the end of September 04, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was a good sized room with a balcony overlooking the Ramblas. Allthough it had a decor somewhat dated it was clean, and it was cleaned every day. The breakfast was OK and being able to visit for refreshments throughout the day was a plus point in our opinion. There was a tendancy to find the eggs somewhat undercooked a couple of mornings but this did not upset us as there are other items to fill you up. A major benefit is the central location of the hotel on the Ramblas just around the corner from Placa de Catalunya Square, very handy for the airport bus. Just sitting on your balcony having a drink of wine or beer watching the world go by and the sun go down was very relaxing, after a very busy day in this wonderful but hectic city. You really do have to get a balcony room to make the most of your stay at this quaint but dated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad points”
Reviews.Author: SDNNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just returned from four nights at the Hotel Continental in Barcelona. The Hotel reception is on the second floor of the building and can be reached by a small elevator which didn't smell too fresh. The reception area is a little shabby, but the staff are very friendly. Our room was just off the reception area and although we'd read about the outdated decor on this site, it really did come as a shock. George Orwell is said to have stayed here in the 30's - well, it looks like he picked the wallpaper and carpets because they've got to be that old at least. Despite being a balcony room with window over La Rambla, it was dark and dreary with a very musty smell. The bathroom also smelled quite badly and we discussed the idea of walking straight out and finding another hotel. We decided to stay and I have to say that after a while we did get used to the decor and once the room was aired it was quite comfortable and clean. Obviously we were prepared to deal with the noise of La Rambla, and this was reduced to a murmur when the balcony doors were closed, but noise within the hotel was bothersome at times because of the thin walls. Noise from the dining area which adjoined our room wasn't a problem, but the resident dog's barking at times through the night was. It's a big dog with a big bark and would be a problem for light sleepers. The worst noise problem became apparent when a couple moved in to the room next door on our last night. Let's just say that they enjoyed themselves frequently and loudly, and we were spared none of the details between banging headboards, enthusiastic vocalisations and creaking bedsprings. This means that the hotel might not give you the privacy required if you want to either be shielded from the shenannigans of others or get up to your own. Although the hotel has some serious negative aspects, there are some very good points which made our stay there very enjoyable despite the bad points. First and foremost is the location which simply couldn't be better. Placa de Catalunya, the hub of the city, is only a few yards away with the Hard Rock Cafe, Corte Ingles and the Metro station within a minute or two's walk. Being able to make a convenient pitstop at your hotel from running round the city all day is a huge advantage. Then, of course, there's La Rambla itself with all it has to offer. The other major plus point is having the balcony room. It was so good to sit with a cold beer or two at the end of a hectic day and watch La Rambla going about its business. The provision of a buffet and the chill cabinet full of reasonably priced beer are also nice touches. On balance, I don't think the Hotel Continental was particularly good value for money. While certainly not the most expensive hotel, the Ramblas rooms aren't bargains either. If the hotel were in any other location it would be horribly over priced given its antiquated decor and limited facilities. The Hotel Cortes, which is just around the corner, has almost as good a location with a much better environment and at a better price. There are any number of hotels nearby that would be better quality at a lower price. I guess it just depends how much that balcony on La Ramblas is worth to you. For us, it just about made it worthwhile putting up with the negatives.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Continental Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Rambla de Canaletets, 138, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
